Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	Therefore, I inserted a needle and cauterized the opening of it, so as to prevent further addition; and then I walked around and I did not know what God had done with that, from that time.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter .xxxvii.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	Of incision of a boil when it is abscesses.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When a catarr arises on the boil, and it is abscesses and it is long, then it is called perpendicular; and if it is in the part below thick and round, and then it is called a bubo.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	But when it is cured with what we have said in the division, and it does not compare to your cure, and then sometimes that abscess cauterized already is gone from it and it is subtle, then you should cut into that which is added round; and if it is to that length, and it is bloody, of brown color or black, and it is not to the touch, then you should attempt the incision of it, because in that there is fear about the patient.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you see that according to the manner that I have said of its whiteness and length, that you should make the patient lie down and press the tongue of it with an instrument of which you process its shape and then place the opening in the navel, and pull that down and cut into it with one of the two instruments which are said in the incision of two mills.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And you should not cut into it unless it is adjusted over the natural term of its addition, because if you cut into it more, you will damage its speaking.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And after the incision, use that which has been recommended in the incision of two mills, and cure that while it is healing.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the patient was frightened by the incision of it, then you should use a needle in the cauterization of it, and the manner of the cautery in it is not but with a sharp water, and it is that you place the head of the patient in your side, and then press the tongue of it with the instrument which we have said, and then take from the water which we have said in the chapter of cauterization, and apply it with that living cause, and place it not thick nor subtle, and from that fill the concavity of the instrument of which this is the shape:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Let the extramitat of its concavity in which the medicine is placed be like the concavity of a spoon of ray, and place the instrument with the medicine on the wound, and the patient yawns on his side so that saliva or mucus of the mouth of that flows through the intrinsic medicine, so that it does not descend from it for any cause over the opening of it and that it is covered.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And then with your hand on the medicine, and express it on the uvula for the space of half an hour until you see it being darkened and sedated by the bite of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you want, take a cotton and envelop it over the extremity of the ray, and submerge the cotton in the medicine, and introduce the ray with the cotton into a tube of above until the cotton adheres to that tube, and do this as many times until you achieve what you want from the cauterization of the uvula, and then remove it when it dries and falls after about three days or four.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you wished to repeat the medicine, repeat it, and after the cauterization, cleanse the circuit of the uvula with cotton dipped in border, and modify it with that which is in the circuit of it of the medicine, and be washed with cold water, and be cured from then on with embrocation, and give gargles until it is healed.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this kind of cure is more safe than incision and more long of fear.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Sometimes the uvula is cured with that which is more subtle than cauterization and incision, because it is cured with fumigation in this manner: take calamine, hyssop, oregano, rue, siccated arabic, chamomile, broyda and similar to those of the herbs, and adjust all of those causes, or some of them, in an olla, and they be submerged in strong wine, and boil; and the olla be well washed with decent lut, and be in the middle of the olla a hole, on which be placed an instrument concave of brass according to this manner; be made of silver or of brass.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And be introduced the extremity into the mouth of the patient until the vapor reaches the uvula on the concha, until the uvula be somewhat obscured.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And then repeat over it many times until it is dry, and guard yourself that you do not do this cure at the beginning of the coming of abscesses, because it would too much adjust in the abscess, and do not do that, but you must declare the abscess of it cauterized.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	But if you do not have this instrument at present, then take a cane and compose in the middle of it a cup of wool, so that the mouth of the patient is covered, because the wool cup prohibits the vapor from burning the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this cure is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter XXXVIII.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	Of the extraction of thorns and of what adheres in the throat and of the other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Many things, stuck in the throat, or thorns or any other cause.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Therefore, you must extract what of those appears, on which the gaze falls, because you press the tongue with an instrument beforehand, so that to you is declared what is in the throat.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And what does not appear and is to you hidden in the throat, you must make the patient vomit before the food is digested in the stomach, because forth, the cause annexed to the throat is thrown-up by vomiting; or make the patient swallow a piece of bread or a root of lettuce or a piece of dry bread; or prepare a piece of dry sea sponge, and tie that firmly with thread, and then make the patient swallow that, because when it arrives at the place in which the thorns are and are extracted, then they are thrown-up.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	And yet take an eel and tie it firmly with thread, and its head is placed and its tail is extracted; or take a porcupine and its quills and its tail are extracted.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	But if they are not thrown-up with those causes which we have said, then use an instrument of lead according to this form:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And it should be thicker than a ray, and in the middle of it there is a concavity which you introduce into the throat with ease.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And hold its head elevated upwards, and guard that the touching of its bone of the throat, so that it may be moved to its body and with that which pushes the bone or the thorn, or that the physician with his hand.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	But however, that the patient that is introduced is milder, for the science of the place of the annexed cause and pushes it down, and pulls his hand with the instrument upwards, all that according to the quantity which is prepared to him before it is thrown-up.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter XXXIX.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	Of the extraction of blood stuck in the throat.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When blood is medicated with what we have said in the division of the cure with medicines and does not conform, consider then in the throat of the patient to the sun, because you have examined the tongue of him with the instrument which to you we have recommended.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Therefore, if you see the blood, extract that with a small onci or with subtle gestures decently.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if it is not possible to extract with that, then take a concave cannula and introduce that into the throat of the patient, and then place in the concavity of the cannula a burning iron, and do this as many times (until the blood is dead and is removed from the throat) and abstain the patient all day from water.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And then prepare a vessel full of cold water, and work the mouth of him in that, and wash the mouth with that; and do not swallow any of that, and evil the water one hour after another with his hand, because the blood as soon as it feels the water catches.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	But if it is not thrown-up with what we have recommended, then subfumigate the patient with thyme or with asafoetida by the instrument which we have recommended in the subfumigation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, so that it may fall.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And there is another way of operation in the subfumigation of that, which is that you take a bowl in which there are burning coals and the bowl is covered with a cover in the middle of which there is a hole, and it is composed in that hole the extremity of the instrument; and then let the subfumigation go down; and place the patient's mouth on the extremity of the cannula, and close his mouth so that the subfumigation is not thrown-up until you know that the subfumigation has arrived at the blood, because the blood as soon as it feels the subfumigation falls.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not catch, then you iterate the subfumigation many times, and abstain the patient from drinking, and eat salty and spicy foods, and do not drink water, and thus it is necessary that with this regimen it be thrown-up.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the form of the instrument with which the blood of the throat is treated when it is seen; and it is similar to forceps as you see, except that in it there is some curvature:
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	which is placed in the throat, and the extremity of it is similar to the beak of a stork, which is gripped, in which it is sharpened with a file, so that, when grasping any cause, it does not let go.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter XL.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the sum of the sermon on the appearance of abscesses and in their section.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Abscesses are many species, of many manners, according to what we remember of them, of each one in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are diverse in perforation and section of them by two manners, of which one is by the species of abscesses in themselves; and by that which we grasp of the humidities.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second way is for the places where boils occur in the body, because the boil that occurs on the head is different from the boil that occurs on the buttocks; and the boil that occurs in the fleshy place is different from the boil that occurs in the joint; and each of them has its own treatment by operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And more boils there are some that should not be pierced but rather allowed to mature by the body's own healing or by the completion of their course.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	And other boils that should be drained when they are ripe, and not allowed to mature by their own course, such as boils that occur near the joints, because when a boil occurs near a joint, its being there is prolonged until the pus that is in the circuit of it is discharged, and then the ligaments or nerves of that joint are corrupted, so that it causes contraction of that limb; or it is a boil near the main member, and if you delay the drainage of it until its maturity, it will cause harm to the main member; or it is near the buttocks, therefore perforate it before it matures; and you should not perforate it crudely, before its proper digestion, but the one that is near the buttocks, so that you cannot reach the perineum of it and prolong it to the parts behind the buttocks, and make a fistula, or that it be done in a way that it is not healed.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	But more importantly, you should know the time of the boil's drainage, and that is when it is mature.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And know that it is mature when there is a cessation of pain and fever, and with the decrease of the redness and pulse, and the sharpness of the head of the boil, and the other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And that you should know that the drainage should be done in the place pus is coming from the boil and from the pus coming from the healing of the eminence.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And the incision should always be made along the length of the flesh or the body, whether the boils are in the parts of the limbs or the feet, and in the places of the tendons, of the nerves, of the arteries; and, lastly, in all places equal to those in which there is no reflection; because in those that are reflected, use the incision according to that limb.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the boil is in a fleshy place, then it is best to let the incision be made after its digestion has been confirmed according to its course, as we have said; because if you perforate it before that, the course of the pus is prolonged and a lot of dirt is produced, and then the lips of it are hardened and the depth of it is increased.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some boils should be incised according to the width of the flesh or the body as necessity demands, or according to what the limb requires.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And you should administer a small incision in small boils, a large and wide or multiple sections in large boils according to the diversity of the size of the boils.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And others are of boils in which the incision should be concave and incised when it is made so that it becomes a pan and it is done in a way that it already adheres, like those that occur in groups of boils and buboes.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And of those there are those that are incised with a section having three angles; and of those there are those that are incised in the way that resembles the shape of a myrtle leaf, like the boils of the armpits.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And of those there are those in which a round incision and a lunar incision, and those similar to them, are administered.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But that one to which there is no such as his boils are superficial, you should perforate it with a superficial incision, or a flat one only.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the boil is large and has already collected a lot of pus, that you perforate it and do not attempt to extract all the pus in that hour; having extracted one part of it, and then close the boil until the next day, and then extract a larger part, and so do this several times according to the degree until it is completely drained.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is of frail virtue, or a pregnant woman, or a small child, or an old person in decrepitude, because the animal spirit is often resolved with the exit of the pus, and then the patient may die, and you should operate on them with caution.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	And guard this chapter with great care, and in the way you perforate these boils, you should abstain from the plagues and consider therefore whether the plague of the boil is small, or a flat section, then you should administer the poultices of it or of a counter-irritant; and if the boil is large, and the fissures of the incision are many, then you should place a piece of cloth in each one until they meet.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the boil a part of the skin is cut off or has been concaved in the circuit, then you should cover it with a piece of old cloth or a thread made of linen, as when you have treated pans or abscesses, with its humidity; and strengthen this on the third day; and then process this and care for it with what is necessary until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	But if there occurs a flow of blood during the operation, then you should administer cold water and vinegar in which you have soaked a piece of linen, and place this over the place of the blood flow several times.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	But if the flow of blood persists, then you should administer a regimen and cure and powders which I have recommended in many places of this our book and of division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	But if it is in wintertime, and the place of the abscess is a place of numb nerves, then you should infuse powders in wine and oil, and place those on the places.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is in summer, and the places are fleshy, then you should place powders mixed with water and oil or with wine and oil, and all that be applied until the third day, as we have said, and then you should open the abscess and cleanse it and administer to its cure what is convenient to it until it is healed.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And thus is what is necessary of the knowledge of the cure of abscesses universally, but according to the way of distinction I have already said of every abscess in what manner is the way of its cure by chapters individually.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter .xli.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Of the section of abscesses which come in the nape of the neck.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the nape of the neck, small abscesses appear, and they are of a kind of nodes which contain tunics that are to their making; and the kinds of them are many.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And of them are pimples, and of those it is that contain humidity similar to lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And of those are the ones that contain humidity similar to dust, and resembling to them; and of those are the ones that are stony, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the section of all of them, and in the extraction of those there is no fear, as you must the exterior of those does not make contrary artery.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in section of those is that you probe those with an instrument the shape of which comes near thus, which is called entromes, as long as you know that it contains.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	Because if that which contains is humidity, then you should divide that with section according to the length by superficial section according to this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And begins in the section of the line of .B. into the line of .G. Therefore, as the humidity is evacuated, then you excoriate that skin that contains that humidity, and do not leave of that any cause of all, because troops once gone back, if there remain of that any cause.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And then you submerge the wound in Egyptian wash, if it is present, and if not, in water and salt; and fill with that the wound and leave it for another day, because with that you corrode all that is broken of that skin.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And then repeat on that wound with Egyptian wash second and third time if you need it, until you are confident that there is no longer any cause of that skin; then cure the wound with wash until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if the abscess contains fatty nodes, then you should cut that according to this form:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	with a section having the shape of a cross, and get onces between the two lips of the section and scrape that from all parts, and exert your strength in the extraction of the tunic which contains that.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	But if to your artery makes opposition, then do what I have told you first.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly do in the stony abscess of section and cure according to what we have told you; and section on a stony abscess is easier, because it is of little blood and of little humidity.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And sometimes there are some of these abscesses which are in the head of some men with which there is no humidity at all; the cause of which is because I incised upon an abscess in the head of an old woman and brought the abscess back as a hard, rough, white sore, which could not be pierced, and if anyone was struck with that, it would plague them.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in the other abscesses accidents in the head other than this is not this chapter, as well as the abscesses that come to the heads of children and you must the roots of the ears, but the section of all these is superficial.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And pause the perforation of those from the lower part of them so that the body be relieved of the sania in the lower parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	And then cure those with what is convenient to that of cure.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter .xlii.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	Of the section of scrophulas which happen in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Many times these abscesses become in the neck and in the armpits and in the groin; and sometimes they happen in the other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that happen in the neck, and there are many that are generated between them, and all scrofula of those is within its own tunic, and as in the nodes and abscesses of the head, as we have recounted.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the kinds of these scrophulas are many, because of those there are some stony, and of those there are that contain humidities, and of those are malignant ones which do not obey to cure.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore, in that which you see of good disposition in the Touch, of which the color of that which is manifest is proper to the color of the neck, and is soft to all parts, and is not annexed to the nerve of the neck, nor to the veins, nor to the artery, and is not hard, then you should incise that with superficial section from the lower part to the upper part of the body of the line of .G. into the line of .B., and scrape that from all parts, and extend the lips of the neck with onces, or with many onces if you have need of those, as we have said in the abscesses of the head, and extract that little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is more caution that the vein or nerve is not cut.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And let the spatula not be too sharp, so that you do not hurt the patient with a cut, or that you cut what is not necessary to cut; for if you were to cut a vein or artery and you prohibited yourself from your operation, then pause in the plague vitriol crushed or other powders which stop the flow of blood, and tighten the wound, and leave that within which rests the sharpness of the abscess and be softened the wound and begin to be pus.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood is separated.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Therefore, return to your operation until you have completed it.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then inquire with your little finger if there is any cause of the other small abscesses, therefore cut those and cleanse them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if it is in the root of the large abscess, then cover it so that you do not cut that abscess from its root.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Cover it so that you place it with a strong double bandage and let it stay until it falls by itself naturally.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	And then fill the wound with old cloth which you have already submerged in Egyptian ointment, and then cure it.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you cut that abscess entirely, then cover it so that you adjust the two lips of the wound and close it as soon as pus comes out so that there is no superfluous discharge.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you see that there is an excess of discharge due to the size of the abscess, cover it so that you understand to cut the root of it, and remove it and administer suture and what is said.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And those of the abscesses that contain humidity, perforate it with a superficial perforation where you see the place of maturation of it, and place a perforation of it so that the pus flows from the lower part of the body, as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	And then administer the perforation, washes with ointment and similar things to those, so that it corrodes what is coming from the corruption.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And then when you see the wound already cleaned, then cure it with ointment of generative flesh until it is healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter XLIII.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	Of the incision of the abscess of the boil within the groin.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients said this incision in the groin, and I have not seen any man in our land that it has been done.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of the sermon of those.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	But in men having a hernia, cover that the extraction of the groin be avoided, as for that it is not well done for their sake because all the veins and major arteries of the body are here.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	But in those who have abscesses caused in the mouth or groin or both ears, when the illness is not in the canal, cover that you use the incision of the groin to avoid the damage which is done by perforation.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, cover that when we want this, that they cut the groin below three circles of the circles of the groin, or four with a small incision for the latitude in that which is between two circles by quantity, that the incision be in the fascia, not in the cartilage, and this place is convenient for incision, because it is deprived of flesh and the vessels of blood of it are there.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the physician is fearful, cover that he extends the groin with an incision, and then open the groin until it reaches the canal, but avoid the blood vessels if you see any cause of them.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And then cut the fascia according to what we have recommended; and it is significant on the incision of the canal by the flame which is of that exit with what is of it disrupted and by the abscess of the voice.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And leave the wound open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Therefore, as the hour is renewed in which perforation is feared, add two lips of the groin of the wound, and stitch it alone if it is the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And then administer medicines that make flesh grow until it is healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Albucasis says that the sum of the sermon which we have recommended, the exposition is not but that you see that some of these abscesses have already opened the groin of the patient, and the patient has come into death, and the ale of it is dried up, and some go to cut the epiglottis so that the patient breathes over the place of the wound for some respiration, and be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And for that reason, I command to leave the wound open until the malice of the illness is consumed; and the malice of it is for three days; and then cover that you close the wound, and cure it until it is healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And that which I have seen with my own eyes, is that a servant took a knife and placed it in his groin and cut with it a part of the canal of the lung, and I was called to the cure of him, and I brought back the woman as it is mooed of the dead, and I uncovered the wound and brought back the blood which was coming out of the wound small.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore, I was confessed that he had not cut a vein nor guided it, and the wind was coming out of the wound, and I cured it until it was healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And I did not accuse the servant if not for the voice, and after some days returned to the improvement of his dispositions.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that in the section of the epileptic there is no fear.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter XLIV.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Of incision over an abscess which happens in the throat outside, and is called a hernia of the throat.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This abscess called a hernia of the throat is a large abscess according to the color of the body, and it moves in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it is according to two ways, whether it is natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And in the natural one it is not a matter of curing.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	And the accidental one is according to two ways, one of which is similar to fatty nodes, and the other way is similar to an abscess that is made by the blockage of an artery, and in that one there is fear.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And no cove that it be made presumption to it, like iron, but in that which is small.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And you probe that one and investigate that one with the said, and if you find it similar to a fatty node, and it is not suspended by any of the veins, then you incise that one as the nodes, and extract that with what contains it of the skin and bursa; and if not, then you scrutinize all its being, and then care for the place with what is necessary for healing before it is healed.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter XLV.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	Of incision of the species of nodes.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	Of nodes there are many species and I have already said all the species of them in the division.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And I must recount as the difference between a node and an excrescence as if making a doubt.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	Therefore, I say that in an excrescence there is heat and fever and violent pains until the boiling of the superfluity is stopped; and it is a putrefaction that then ceases the fever, the pain, and the heat.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But in a node there is neither heat nor fever nor pain, and it contains that which is in the sac proper to it.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And it is according to the color of the body, and its beginning is like a cyst and it is made so as a vacuum, whether it is larger or smaller, and they are according to two species, whether they are fatty and contain humidity, and the colors of the humidity are many, according to what I said in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore, when you come to the cure of a node, that you examine it and inquire about it at the beginning with the instrument that is called intromes, according to how it will come its form in the chapter which is near this.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And the manner of inquiry of abscesses and of all nodes, and it is that you take this instrument and introduce it into the place most humid which you find in the abscess, and you revolve your said ones with that little by little until you know that the instrument has already penetrated the core.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	And then last your hand according to the measure of the greatness of the abscess, and then extract the intromes and consider what is issued in the trace of it.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if the humidity is flowing out, of whatever color it may be, then you incise it with a superficial incision according to what I have said in the other abscesses.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if from the trace of the intromes there is no humidity, then you know that it is fatty.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And dry over it with an incision having the shape of a cross according to this form:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	as such as I have taught you, and suspend that with tweezers, and excoriate the core from all parts with ease, and keep the skin or sac, if you can, over it and extract that sania with the node.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if it is broken in the operation, it is not possible to extract that sania, and many times it must be so, and then you extract it in pieces until there remains no cause from it.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	Because if from it remains no cause, little or much, the node returns according to the most.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that from it remains any small part, then fill the wound with some sharp and corrosive powders and strengthen the wound, and place on it a cautery of the abscess, and cure it with the other cure until it is healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if it is a large node, then you sew the two lips of it and cure it with what is necessary for healing.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	But if a pulsatile vein is to it contrary, or non-pulsatile, then you cauterize and fill the place of a zegi three times that is vitriol and leave it straight for two days or three until you can scar the wound and that it rests the boiling of the blood; and then return to incise that which is broken from the node.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter XLVI.
De las formas del sturmentz necessaris en seccio e perforacio.	Of the forms of the instruments necessary in incision and perforation.
De aquels so las formas dels intromesas, e so de tres specias, que de aquels es alcu gran, e de lor es migier, e de lor es petit.	Of those there are the forms of the intromes, and they are of three species, of which one is large, and of those one is medium, and of those one is small.
La forma de intromes gran es aquesta:	The form of the large introme is this:
La forma de intromes migier es aquesta:	The form of the medium introme is this:
La forma de intromes petit es aquesta:	The form of the small introme is this:
Sian faytz de ferr, de alfulud, de extremitatz cayradas decentment, per so que festino le intrament en les apostemas.	They shall be made of iron, of lead, of extremities well-rounded, so that they fit the entrance into the abscesses.
E aquestas so las formas dels experientz, e son nompnatz albered, e un de aquels es apelat berid.	And these are the forms of the instruments, and they are called probes, and one of them is called a berid.
E so de tres especias, quar de lor es gran, migier e pauc.	And there are three kinds, of which one is large, medium, and small.
La forma de experient gran, forma de lu:	The form of the large one, its form:
La forma de experient migier, forma de lu:	The form of the medium one, its form:

E so faytz redontz, grosses, leons, ayssi cum grans agulhas am las quals son cosidas las selhas, e son faytas de eram citri, o de eram o de ferr, o de argent, E las milhors so quan so faytas de eram citri.	And they are made round, thick, like needles, as with which the stitches are sewn, and they are made of citrus copper, or of tin, or of iron, or of silver, And the best ones are when they are made of citrus copper.
E son faytz les experient de plum negre, les quals se acordan que per aquels sian ubertas las fistulas en la conquavitat de las quals so reflexios, que sian reflectidas am la sua levitat am aquelas refleccios.	And they are made the instruments of black plum, the ones that are agreed that for those to be openings the fistulas in the concavity of which are reflections, that they are reflected with their lightness with those reflections.
E so de tres specias, quar alcus de lor so loncs, e dels autres migiers, e dels autres breus, segon la quantitat del ample de la fistula e de la strictura de lu.	And they are of three kinds, because some of them are long, and others medium, and others short, according to the quantity of the width of the fistula and of its stricture.
Forma del experient gran de plom:	Form of the large plum instrument:
Forma del experient migier de plom:	Form of the medium plum instrument:
Forma del experient petit de plom:	Form of the small plum instrument:

The forms of the probes are of many kinds, because of those some are simple, to which there is only one curvature, and they are of three kinds: large, small, and medium.
E de lor so uncis orps, e so de tres specias.	And of them are curved probes, and they are of three kinds.
E de aquels so uncis haventz doas curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	And of those are probes having two curvatures, and they are of three kinds.
E de lor so haventz tres curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	And of them are having three curvatures, and they are of three kinds.
E totz aquetz so necessaris en lor loc.	And all of these are necessary in their place.
Forma de unci simple gran, forma de lu:	Form of a simple large probe, form of it:
Forma de unci simple migier:	Form of a simple medium probe:
Forma de unci simple pauc, forma de lu:	Form of a simple small probe, form of it:
Forma de unci orp gran:	Form of a curved large probe:
Forma de unci orp migier, forma de lu:	Form of a curved medium probe, form of it:
Forma de unci orp pauc, forma de lu:	Form of a curved small probe, form of it:
Forma de unci gran havent dos curvaturas:	Form of a large probe having two curvatures:
Forma de unci migier havent dos curvatas:	Form of a medium probe having two curvatures:
Forma de unci pauc havent dos curvaturas:	Form of a small probe having two curvatures:
Forma de unci gran havent tres curvaturas:	Form of a large probe having three curvatures:
Forma de unci migier havent tres curvaturas:	Form of a medium probe having three curvatures:
Forma de unci pauc havent tres curvaturas:	Form of a small probe having three curvatures:

And these are the forms of the scalpels with which the nodes and abscesses are cut and scraped, and they are of three kinds, because some of them are large, medium, and small.
Forma de scapel gran:	Form of a large scalpel:
Forma del scapel migier:	Form of the medium scalpel:
Forma de scapel pauc:	Form of a small scalpel:
Las extramitatz de aquels am les quals es fayta seccio so agudas e las autres extramitatz so no-agudas, e no so pausadas en tal manieyra, sino per que sia fayt juvament en la excorjacio dels nodes la temor de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e per aquels sia sanat le malaute e atrobe tranquilitat un petit per la adustio la qual atroba deves la excoriacio del apostema.	The extremities of those with which the section is made are sharp and the other extremities are not sharp, and they are not placed in such a manner, but that it may be done carefully in the scraping of the nodes the fear of incision of vein or nerve, and that by those the malady may be healed and tranquility be restored a little by the burning which causes the scraping of the abscess.
E aquestas son las formas de almagidas, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc, ayssi cum veyras.	And these are the forms of spatulas, and they are of three kinds: large, medium and small, as you see.
La forma de magda gran:	The form of a large spatula:
Forma de magda migier:	Form of a medium spatula:
Forma de magda pauc:	Form of a small spatula:
Sian faytas de eram e so semblantz de ray am le qual e fayt alcofol.	They are made of copper and are similar to a ray with which and made alcohol.
E es en la extramitat lada punctada am spatum occultada e en aquela corr a las partidas dedintz e defora, quan tu vols, ayssi cum veses.	And it is in the lateral extremity pointed with a spatula hidden and in that it runs to the inside and outside parts, when you want, as you see.
Las formas de spatimis, les quals so amaguatz entre los ditz deves la perforacio dels apostemas e no les percebo les malautes, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc.	The forms of spatulas, which are hidden between the fingers during the perforation of abscesses and the patients do not perceive them, and they are of three kinds: large, medium and small.
E aquestas so las formas de aquels:	And these are the forms of those:
Las formas de ventozas am las quals es abscindit le flux del sanc, e so de tres specias; gran, migiera e pauca; las formas de lu:	The forms of cupping glasses with which the flow of blood is removed, and they are of three kinds; large, medium and small; the forms of them:
Sian faytas de eram citri, redondas am alcuna longitut , e sian subtils.	They are made of citrus copper, round with some length, and they are subtle.
E cove que sian aquestas specias de ventosas deves tu grans, migieras e paucas, per so que per aquelas abscindas flux de sanc am velocitat en necessitat, e lahoras quan a tu primieyrament no es medicina.	And know that these kinds of cupping glasses, great, medium and small, are so that by them the flow of blood is removed with speed in need, and then when to you first it is not medicine.
Enpero no uses de aquelas ad abscidir sanc en tot loc del cors, e non uses sino en locs carnoses, ayssi cum en les lacertis de las cambas e de las coyssas, e en les lacertz dels brasses, e de las mamillas e del ventre e dels engonars, e semblantz a lor dels lacertz carnoses humitz.	However, do not use those to remove blood in every place of the body, and do not use them except in fleshy places, such as in the folds of the arms and legs, and in the folds of the breasts, and of the belly and groin, and similar to those of the fleshy, moist folds.
E alcunas veguadas son faytz de aquels strumentz autres petitz semblantz scorsas de fisacs segon aquesta forma; per les quals lo sanc es abscindit quan es fayt per fleubotomia, o deves inscizio de vena o de arceria.	And sometimes they are made of those instruments other small ones resembling fish scales according to this form; by which the blood is removed when it is done by phlebotomy, or by incision of vein or artery.
E alcunas veguadas son faytas redondas segon aquesta forma:	And sometimes they are made round according to this form:
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter .xlvii.
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	Of the cure of the nipples of men which are assembled from women.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Sometimes the nipples of certain men are inflamed due to the compliment of sleeping as they begin to become hairy, and then the nipples are inflamed, and the nipples are assembled from women, and Roman abscesses, they are removed.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And to that one who avows this, it is necessary to cut those with a lunar section according to this form, from the line of B. into the line of G., and then scrape the entire thickness, and then fill the wound with a medicament of carnation, and then adjust the two lips of the wound with stitching, and take care of it until it is healed.
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the nipple leans towards the parts below and is softened by its magnitude as it should be in women, then it is cut in two halves with its surplus pus, with two sections resembling the lunar figure, of which each one should be contained in the other, as long as the major line contains the minor according to this form of the line of B. and the line of G. And then scrape the cord which is between the two lips of the wound, and remove the fat, and administer what we have said of the suture and the poultices, which is necessary for the cure until it is healed.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you do not comply with the incision of this which it is necessary to cut because of the restlessness of the patient, and the flow of blood, then it is necessary to fill the wound with a cloth submerged in corrosive ointment and leave it until that which corrodes is removed from the gray, and then take care of it until it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter .xlviii.
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	Of the perforation of abscesses that come from below the nipple.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	These abscesses that come from below the nipple are of the species of scrofulas, hard, which contain a skin that is removed.
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.	And of those, some contain humidity; and those that contain humidity, it is necessary to be incised with a lunar section according to this figure: from the line of G. to the line of B. And as it is all evacuated that is in the abscess of the healthy, then you fill it with old cloth and leave it until the next day.
E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	And then the cloth is removed and it is cured with a suitable ointment to it, until it is healed.
E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment.	And if the abscess is of the species of nodes and of scrofulas, then you cut it as we have said in the section about scrofulas in the same way.
May si la plagua es extenduda en aysso que yesca poyredura, lahoras administra en lu cauteri segon que en aquo havem denant dit.	But if the wound is extended in such a way that it becomes a pockmark, then administer cautery to it according to what we have said before.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter .xlix.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	Of the section of abscesses that happen because of artery or vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When an artery is ruptured, and the cord which is above it is consolidated, then many times abscesses happen. And the signs by which it is known that inflammation and abscess are from the artery or vein: that when an abscess is from the artery it is long aggregated in the front of the body; and that when you press the abscess with your fingers, you feel in it that which is stridor.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And that which is from the vein is round to the manifest of the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And the section on this abscess is an error, and most of all in that which is below the armpits, and in the corners, and in the neck, and in many places of the body; and it is very large, therefore it is necessary to avoid its cure with iron, and that which is in the extremities, or on the head, it is necessary to avoid.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	But on that which is of those by inflammation of the orifice of the artery, cut a section in the cord, in the long; and then scrape the section with hooks, and then the artery, and deliver from the tunics until it is uncovered.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And then put on that needle and make it penetrate into the other side, and tighten the artery with a double thread in two places, — which causes you to ease in the extraction of two arteries which are in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And then prick the place which is between two ligaments with a spatula until the blood that is in it is removed, and the abscess is dissolved.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then administer a cure in which it is engendered power until the ligaments fall; and then take care of it with suitable ointments to it until it is healed.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	And if the abscess is from the section of a vein, then it is necessary for you to have with your hand that which is possible of the abscess with the cord, and then introduce the needle below the place which you have had below your hand, and make it penetrate; and be in that double thread until you extract it from the other side, and then tie the abscess with a good ligament according to what I have told you in the ligament of the grape of two parts with two extremities of the thread.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	But if you fear that the thread will be extracted, then introduce the thread with that needle below the whole abscess, from the incision of the first needle, and tighten your threads in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	Then dry the abscess in the middle place of it until when it is emitted that which is in it, then you cut the superfluity of the cord, and leave that which of it is tied.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then place on it the powder which you have soaked in wine and oil, and then administer the cure which is made with warm and damp cloths while it is healing.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter 1 of the abscess which occurs due to a twisting of nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Thus as abscesses occur in arteries and veins, and similarly abscesses occur in nerves when they are struck or overworked, and by similar means.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it is made most in the places of the arms or the ankle, or in any place where the joints are bad.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And it is a serious abscess, and it is similar in color to the rest of the body, and in the majority of its dispositions it is painful and when it is tightened with violence, the patient feels like a stupor.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And it is not an abscess that is attached in the front of the body, and for this reason the chain is left, and it is bad in every part and does not go to the parts in front or behind.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, those that are in the joints should not be enclosed with iron, because it will very much increase contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But those that are in the head or on the forehead, bind with a spatula.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if it is a small abscess, then take it with the forceps and cut it from the root.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, then you suspend it with a hook, and scrape it, and then put it back; and adjust the wound with suture, and care for it until it is healed.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 2.
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	Of the incision of an abscess that occurs from a boil that occurs in the belly.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	And it happens to some men, growths in the bellies of those and in other parts of the body of those, which are called fungals because of their resemblance to fungi, of which the root is subtle and the head of it is thick; and already the lips of those are converted, and it is of those that is small, and it is of those that is very magnified.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I have already seen one, and in the belly of him there were two parts which were more like fungi, and there was no difference between them, white, of fine root.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And already the lips of those were reversed and were splitting, and moisture was running from it all the time.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore, I incised those and took out of one in a weight of eighteen ounces. and the other, six ounces.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the operation in the incision of them is that you consider, if the patient is humid, and the color of the boil is white, humid, of subtle root; then you should incise it with a spatula, and have in your presence cauteries in the fire, because many times the blood should be expelled from the section of it; and if you see the blood, cauterize it.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if you see the patient fearful and afraid, guard yourself from incision with iron; but rather, take a leaden ball recently made, and strengthen it with that boil, the manner of which is that which we have said; and leave it there for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	And then adjust in the tightness of the leaden thread; therefore, do not cease to strengthen the lead greatly, until it is cut off and falls by itself through its work.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the boil is of thick root, then in the incision of it there is some cause of fear and of terror, and more so in that which is in the belly.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	But it is possible that you should incise the majority of it, and then cauterize it so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And then care for it until the wound is healed.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And guard yourself that you do not presume to incise those that are of dusky color, of little feeling, of little regard, because those are cancerous abscesses.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I will come with a remembrance of cancer, then.
