Capitol .lii.	Chapter 3.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	Of the cure of an eminence of the navel.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	Eminence of the navel is made by many causes; or by fissures of the skin which is on the belly, and from which the cloth or intestine comes out according to how it should be in the other ruptures; or by blood which flows from a vein or artery according to what has been said before, or by wind contracted in it.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	But if it is by a fissure of the skin and by the protrusion of the cloth, then the color of the abscess is similar to the color of the body; and it is lean in pain, and then appears of different situations.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is by the egress of the intestine, then the situation of it with that which we have recounted, of greater and diverse variety, and when you press it with your fingers, it is hidden, and then returns; and very much is felt in it, and it is magnified a great deal by the introduction of baths and violent labor.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	But if it is by humidity, then it is lean and is not hidden when you press it with your hand, nor is it constricted, nor is it increased.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is by blood, then with these signs appears the abscess in a declining blackness.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	But if it is by flesh nothing, then the abscess is serious, thick and hard, and it is placed according to a quantity.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	But if it is by wind, then the touch of it is light.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation on him is that you consider at this time if the prominence of the navel is from artery blood, or from vein, or from wind; therefore, if it is prohibited from the cure of him, because in that there is fear and fear as you have been taught in the chapter in which I have said the abscesses by artery and by vein.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the prominence of the navel is from the intestine or from the cloth, then you must command the patient to hold his leg, and be standing extended; and then you will try in the circuit of all the navel, and then command him to stay between his hands on his two, and then surround with a spatula wide in the circuit of the navel on the place which you have marked with the probe; and then extend the majority of the abscess to the parts above with a large finger; and then tie it in the circuit with a strong thread or with a cord and the manner of tying is decent.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	And then break the middle of the abscess extended over the ligament and introduce your finger into that indication and seek the intestine; and if you have found it or guarded by the ligament, then you extract it and impel the intestine to the parts behind the belly.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have found the cloth, then take that with a finger; and cut the superfluities of it.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if it is contrary to your artery or vein, then surround that spot, and then return to your operation; and take two needles and put in those two strong threads and introduce two needles in the circuit which you have made around the abscess in a manner of cross, which you make penetrate; and then strengthen the abscess in four parts over the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you want, remove the needles and leave the place until you can feel the flesh extended and fall by itself; or cut that when it is softened and can be, and then cure that with water which is customary of the unguents until it is healed.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if the prominence of the navel is of flesh nothing in it or by humidity, then you must concave the abscess as we have said and extract the blood or the humidity, which you find in it, and then cure that with water which is customary and that consolidates the place.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter .liii.
De curacio de cranc.	Of the cure of cancer.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have already said, in the division, of the species of cancer and in what manner it is cured with medicines, and that it is harmful in it the cure with iron because it is not ulcerated; and we have said cancer generated in the marrow and caution of the cure of it.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	And they said the ancients that sometimes cancer is in a place where it is possible the eradication of it, as of the cancer which is in the nipples or in the groin and their likeness of the members allocated to extract all that, and more when it is beginning small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when it is ancient and is large, you must not trust in it, because I have not been able to heal from that at all, nor have I seen another, nor that has come to that.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	And the operation on it is when it is allocated as we have said, is that you precede and leave the patient and purge of black bile some times, and then bleed him, if a manifest repletion is found.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	And then prepare the patient with the preparation in which he is located for the operation, and prohibit in the tract incisions which are necessary for it; and then concave from all part with the good saw careful excision until there remains no cause of the roots of it.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	And let the blood run, and do not cut this lightly, and express the places, and wipe the thick blood all with your hand or with the instrument with which it is possible to you of the instruments.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if to you it makes contrariety of thick blood incision of vein or of artery, then cauterize that until the flux of the blood is ceased, and then cure that with the other cure until it is healed.
Capitol .liv.	Chapter .liv.
De curacio de ydropici.	Of the cure of hydropic.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already recounted, in the division, of the species of hydropic of the water, and the signs of each species, of the cure of it with medicines.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	And that which is cured with iron is only the species of althitas alone, and it is not approached with iron to the species of tympanistres nor to the species of yposarcha, because that is mortal.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	And when you have already medicated this species of hydropic tympanist with medicines and do not confer your medication, then consider, that if to the patient already is achieved debility, or is in that other illness another hydropic, as if it is in him cough or chest of belly and similar to those, then guard you that you do not medicate him with iron, because fear is upon that.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	But if you see the patient of exuberant virtue, and in him there is no other illness but hydropic so only, and not a child nor old, then the manner of the operation of it is that you elevate the patient between your hands, and the minister then expresses the belly of him with his hand, expelling the water to the part below the navel, and then take a spatula thorny according to this form:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	be of two parts acute long, of acute extremity as a spatula; but however be in it some brevity small by small, so that in the operation with that you do not pass into the intestine, and that you lead that.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	And consider if the generation of hydrops is from the bowels, for when you have the section at the navel, you should move three fingers to the left side, on the right side of the belly.
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	But if the generation of hydrops is due to liver disease, then your incision should be to the left of the navel, three fingers.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if the generation of it is from the spleen, then your incision should be on the right.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And do not let your incision be on the side where the patient wants to make the incision because it will not allow the superfluities to flow to that place freely.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	And then perforate with the instrument the entire  area, and enter into that incision, and elevate your hand with the spatula between the fascia and the skin, and you excoriate that; and if the quantity of a fingernail or around.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	And then perforate the skin until the spatula reaches the desired place, and it is the place of the water.
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then extract that and insert an instrument of which this is the shape:
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	and it is similar to a silver cannula; it is made of silver or lead or tin, to which at the lower part of it is a small hole, and on the sides of it are three holes: two on one side and one on the other side; and the tip of it is made blunt according to the manner of a feather, thus as sometimes:
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And at the tip of it most sovereign is a ring, for when the instrument reaches the water, then it instantly rises on the instrument, therefore evacuates the water in the middle hour quantity, for if you evacuate from that more than you should in the hour, very soon the patient will die by resolution of their animal spirit, or you will bring him to five-pi (a state close to death).
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	But evacuate from that according to the quantity of its virtue and according to what the dispositions of the patient signify to you from the virtue of the pulse of him and from the goodness of him.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	And then extract the instrument, and retain the water which is the cause for it is immediately retained by the fascia which retains the hole that is on the skin of it and recommits to you that you perforate it according to that manner.
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	And then repeat the instrument the next day if the patient tolerates the water, and extract a small quantity of water, and do water for several days with fear, and guard yourself from error so that it does not remain of the water but little.
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	But if you fear about the patient, and let the water a great quantity, then cure him with burial in hot sand, and bathe him in hot water, and in the sun wait for a long time; and cure him with drying medicines until he is healed.
E cauteriza sobre le stomac, e la melsa e·l fitge aprop la extraccio de l’aygua, segon que yeu he recontat en aquo que es precedit.	And cauterize on the stomach, and the spleen and the liver after the extraction of the water, according to what I have recounted in what is preceding.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter .lv.
De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	Of the cure of children who are born with the places of the urine not perforated.
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	Sometimes some of the children are like this from the womb of their mother and the head of their mixture is not perforated (or it is a straight hole or it is not in its place).
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	Therefore, it is necessary to repair with perforation of it as soon as it is born with a very fine spatula according to this form:
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	And then place in the hole a fine lead nail and tie that, and keep it for three days or for four.
E quant vol urinar sia remaugut e hurine; e aprop retorne aquel.	And when he wants to urinate, he will be urged and urinate; and then return that.
E si tu no pauses le plom, ja es possible que la urina la qual va sobre le loc, no leysa aquest claure.	And if you do not place the lead, it is possible that the urine which goes on the place, will not let this opening.
Mays aquel del qual le trauc es streyt sia medicat am clavil de Plom, ayssi cum havem dit, per trops dias entro que sia amplificat.	But that one whose hole is straight, be medicated with a lead nail, as we have said, for too many days until it is amplified.
Mays aquels en les quals es le trauc no en son loc, so leditz, la qual causa es quar de aquels, aquel que es nat e·l trau es deves la fi del cap de la vergua per que no pot urinar a las partidas dedintz, entro que eleva la vergua am la sua ma a las partidas desus; e no es a lu generacio, per so quar le sperma no pot pervenir a la mayre segon rectitut, e es malautia mot laga.	But those in which the hole is not in its place, are led by the cause for those, the one who is born and the hole is deviated, he deserves the end of the head of the vagina because he cannot urinate in the parts below, until he raises the vagina with his hand to the parts above; and it is not to him generation, for so the sperm cannot reach the mother according to rectitude, and it is a very bad disease.
E la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que·l malaute sia envessat sobre le sieu dos, e aprop exten le cap de la vergua de lu am la tua ma sinistra am vehement extraccio, e inscideys le cap del cap de la vergua del loc del perpucii am spatum agut, ayssi cum es inscizio de pluma, o que tu ne razas alcuna partida, per so que·l mieg de lu vengua semblant al cap de la vergua e que le trauc caia en le mieg loc segon que cove.	And the manner of the operation in him is that the patient be inverted on his back, and then extend the head of the vagina of him with your left hand with vehement extraction, and inscise the head of the head of the vagina of the place of the perpucii with a sharp spatula, as it is incision of a feather, or that you do not cut any part, so that the middle of him comes similar to the head of the vagina and that the hole falls in the middle place as it should.
E guarda te que en la tua operacio de flux de sanc, quar motas vetz accideys aquo; e pausa te a lu am aquo que abscindeys le sanc, e cura la plagua entro que si’ sanada.	And guard yourself in your operation of blood flow, for many times accidents happen there; and pause yourself to him with the water that you abscind the blood, and cure the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lvi.	Chapter .lvi.
De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	Of the white that happens in the prepuce at the head of the vagina and of corruption and blackness and adherence of the prepuce of the head of the vagina.
Motas veguadas accideys aquest albater en la vergua e es eminencia de carn laga.	Many times this white happens in the vagina and it is a prominence of bad flesh.
E de aquela una es maligna e autra es no-maligna.	And of that one is malignant and the other is non-malignant.
No-maligna, cove que suspendas am unci subtil e abscindas aquela entro que aquela mondes tota; e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto submirgit en enguent egipciac; e aprop aquel, cura le am enguent diafinicon entro que sia sanat.	Non-malignant, however, which you suspend with a fine thread and cut that which is within that whole; and then place on that root submerged in Egyptian poultice; and then that, cure it with the diaphonic poultice until it is healed.
E si albater es maligna, de lega color, lahoras cove que tu aministres cauteri aprop la inscizio de lu e la razio de lu.	And if the ulcer is malignant, of a leg color, then you must administer cautery to the edge of it and the root of it.
Mays si albater es en le prepuci del cap de la vergua no-circumcis, e la una partida de albater es dedintz le prepucii e l’autra partida es defora, lahoras cove que tu ostes albater le qual es dedintz al comensament entro que es consolidat; e lahora tu cura aquel deforo, quar quan tu curas aquel ensemps le prepuci, no es asegurat que no sia trinquat.	But if the ulcer is in the prepuce of the head of the uncircumcised penis, and one part of the ulcer is inside the prepuce and the other part is outside, then you must treat the ulcer which is inside first until it is consolidated; and then you treat the one outside, because when you treat the one outside at the same time as the prepuce, it is not certain that it will not be troubled.
E ja eysamen accideys en les genetius e en le prepuci negror e corruccio, adonc cove que tu conquavas tot aquo que ja es denigrat e que ja se vol corrompre o que ja es corrumput; e aprop lineys sobre aquel aprop aquo am mel, le qual es contusit am farina de scorsa de milgrana e de errs trissatz e crivellatz.	And if there happen to be blackening and corruption in the genitals and the prepuce, then you must remove all that which is already blackened and that which is about to corrupt or that which is already corrupted; and then apply a line over that with honey, which is mixed with the flour of the bark of pomegranate and of crushed and sifted herbs.
E aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sana.	And then treat that with the other treatment until it is healed.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, lahoras aministra cauteri lunar segon aquesta forma:	But if there is a flow of blood, then administer lunar cautery according to this form:
quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	Because cautery is helpful in two dispositions at once, so it is in the flow of blood and in the plague when it is corrupted.
E si le cap de la vergua es corrodut e es destruit tot en la hora, lahoras cove que tu intrometas en lo meat del prepucii una canula de plom per so que le malaute urina per aquela.	And if the head of the penis is corroded and is destroyed all at once, then you must introduce into the flesh of the prepuce a lead tube so that the patient urinates through that.
En la adherencia del prepucii am le cap de la vergua (et aquesta adherencia no accideys sino en aquel del qual le prepucii es sa, e sobre lu no es exhigida circumcizio; e quan accideys adherencia per plagua o per apostema) cove que excorjas am spatum obtus entro que sia dissolvut le liament e sia deliurat le cap de la vergua de tota partida.	In the adhesion of the prepuce to the head of the penis (and this adhesion does not happen except in the case of which the prepuce is sound, and upon it circumcision is not performed; and when adhesion happens because of plague or because of abscess) you must excoriate with a blunt spatula until the ligament is dissolved and the head of the penis is released from all sides.
E si es dificil desirnir aquelas exquisidament, lahoras cove que tu excorjes am spatum alcuna causa del cap de la vergua e del prepucii, e aysso es quar le prepucii, quan es subtil, fort leu es perforat per la sua subtilitat leugierament.	And if it is difficult to separate them exquisitely, then you must excoriate with a spatula some cause of the head of the penis and the prepuce, and thus it is because the prepuce, when it is subtle, is easily perforated by its subtlety.
E aprop separa entre·l prepucii e·l cap de la vergua am dra7 de li subtil, le qual ja es mulhat en l’aygua frega per que no adherescan autra veguada.	And then separate between the prepuce and the head of the penis with a thread of the subtle, which is already softened in cold water so that they do not adhere again.
E aprop sia curat am vi stiptic entro que sia consolidat.	And then treat it with a vi stiptic until it is consolidated.
Capitol .lvii.	Chapter .lvii.
De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	Of the purification of children and the treatment of those who happen to undergo circumcision.
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not a solution of continuity like other plagues: but since it is of our operation and our will, and it is done to those of our own, it is necessary that we assign in that better operation and easier way less loss to health.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	Therefore I say that the ancients did not write about circumcision in some of their books, because they did not use it in their laws, and it is only because we have acquired it through experience, the cause of which is that I have found the majority of the artificers and barbers use circumcision and purification with a knife and with torrets; and they use a ligament with a nail and an incision with the nail.
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura.	And I have already tried all these manners and have not found better purification with shears, with a ligament with a nail than in purification with the nail, because many times the root escapes the most below, because the root of the prepuce has two tunics, and the tunic remains further down, and it is very easy to be forced to another incision and sure pain.
E am mundificacio le qual es fayta per alphecati, e es digital, del qual usan les sabatiers, no es segurada la inscizio de la extremitat del membre viril, quar fort leu intra en le trau de lu.	And in purification which is done by alphecati, and is digital, of which the barbers use, the incision of the extremity of the male member is not assured, because it very easily enters into the furrow of it.
Mays en la operacio am ungla, fort leu obazeys ferr e corromp la tua operacio.	But in the operation with the nail, very easily it is obstructed by iron and corrupts your operation.
E la codena del enfant es breu per natura, e motas veguadas nays en tal manieyra que no ha necessitat de mondificacio, e yeu he vist aquel.	And the root of the child is short by nature, and many times it is in such a manner that there is no need for purification, and I have seen that.
Mays de la mondificacio que·s fa am forfexs e liamentz am fiel, la bontat, experiment descrobic a mi, quar las forfexs so de proporcional inscizio, per aquo quar la acuitat que es desus es ayssi cum la acuitat que es dejos; e donc cum tu premes la tua ma so proporcionadas dos acuitatz, e inscideysso segon una comperacio en un temps; e es fayta compressio del fiel am figura contenent la codena de la vergua de tota partida, am le qual no catz error de tot.	But of the purification which is done with shears and ligaments with a nail, the goodness, experience has shown me, because the shears are of proportional incision, therefore the sharpness that is below is as the sharpness that is above; and therefore as you press your hand so proportionally to the two sharpnesses, and you cut it according to a comparison in one time; and it is made compression of the nail with a figure containing the root of the penis in all parts, with which there is no error of all.
E la manieyra de la operacio primeyra es que tu fassas estar le enfant majorment si es de aquels que entendo un petit, que no fassas sino que tu lies le fiel en la sua vergua tant solament, e que leysses aquel entro al autra dia.	And the manner of the first operation is that you make the child lie most if he is of those who understand a little, that you do nothing but you tie the nail in his penis only, and that you leave it in for another day.
E aprop fay aquel alegrar en tota aquela manieyra que es a tu possibla de aquo que recep la sua intelligencia.	And then make him happy in all that manner that is in your power of what receives his understanding.
E aprop fa aquel estar entre las tuas mas estatuir preparadament, e no sia ges cezent; e occulta las forfexs en la tua ma o dejos le tieu pe, que l’enfant no veia aquelas ni degun autre dels instruments.	And then make him lie between your arms, prepared and do not be seen; and hide the shears in your hand or under your foot, that the child does not see them nor any other of the instruments.
E aprop entremet la tua ma a la vergua de lu e suffla en la codena, e tira aquela entro que sia eyssit le cap de la vergua, e aprop mondifica aquel de aquo que es agregat en ela de sordicia.	And then place your hand in the patient's groin and blow into the canal, and pull it inward until the head of the canal is released, and then modify that which is attached to it of dirt.
E aprop lia le loc signat am fiel dobla, e aprop ligua pus bas de aquel un petit le segon liament, e aprop te am le dit pous e endic tieu le loc del liament dejos am bona retencio, e inscideys entre dos liaments.	And then tie the area signed with a double knot, and then tie the pus lower from that one a little the second ligament, and then take the said finger and indicate your location of the ligament below with good retention, and cut between two ligaments.
E aprop eleva la codena sus leugierament e estratz le cap de la vergua; e aprop leyssa le sanc corre petit e petit, quar es milhor ; e pausa polvera desus e sobre la polvera pausa drap en le qual es spandut mugol de huou coyt en ayguaros concosit am oli rozat recent bo; e layssa aquel sobre aquel entro al autra dia; e cura aquel am curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then elevate the canal slightly and extract the head of the canal; and then let the blood flow out little by little, because it is better; and place powder underneath and above the powder place a cloth in which is spread out a mixture of hog fat in boiling water with roasted olive oil; and leave this on top for another day; and cure this with care until it is healed.
La forma de las forfexs a mondificacio, aquesta es la forma:	The shape of the forceps for modification, this is the shape:
Sian las unas extramitatz no-talhantz e las autras sian talhant, que non sia yssit le ram del clau, e sia la longitut de las doas acuitatz ayssi cum la longitut de dos manubres engualment.	Let the one pair of extremities be non-cutting and the other pair be cutting, so that the handle of the key does not come out, and the length of the two points be as the length of two handles equally.
Mays la error en mundificacio es quar fort leu efugeys la codena intrinseca tota, o partida de lu deves la inscizio.	But the error in modification is that too forcefully it evades the intrinsic canal entirely, or a part of it from which the incision.
Donc cove que tu extendas aquela de la tua hora am la tua ungla denant la apostemacio del loc e que inscidas aquela segon equalitat.	Therefore, so that you extend that of your hour with your nail before the apostema of the place and that you cut it according to equality.
E si no la podes tenir am la tua ungla, lahoras extratz aquela am unci e inscideys aquela.	And if you cannot hold it with your nail, then extract that with a pin and cut it.
Mays si son passatz tres dias, e roman aquo que es imflat dejos la vergua apostemat, lahoras tu leyssa aquo entro que sia cedat le apostema caut, e excorja aquel am fecilitat, e inscidex aquel segon que a tu es preparat.	But if three days have passed, and that which is inflated remains below the groin apostema, then you let it go until the apostema cauterizes, and excoriate that with facility, and cut that according to what is prepared for you.
E guarda te del cap de la vergua, quar no nosera a lu aquo.	And guard yourself from the head of the canal, because it would not be good for that.
E donc cura aquel am aquo que la plagua consolida de las polveras las quals havem recomtadas en le tractat de las polveras.	And therefore cure that with the water that the plague consolidates from the powders which we have recommended in the treatise of the powders.
E si es inscidit de la codena sobre mesura, e obezeys a las partidas desus, aquo no notz a lu.	And if it is incised from the canal beyond measure, and obeys the parts above, then that does not hurt it.
E mays cura aquel am aquo que havem dit entro que sia sanat.	And but cure that with the water that we have said until it is healed.
Capitol .lviii.	Chapter .lviii.
De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	Of the cure of urine retained in the bladder.
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio.	Retention of urine in the bladder is made by obstruction made by stone or by congealed blood, or by pus or by carbuncle, and similar to those of water that we have said of the ways of cure in the division.
E si no es dissolvuda la urina, e veses retencio de lu esser per peyra le qual ja es en le col de la vesica, lahoras cove que le malaute sia encorbat sobre les sieus denolhs.	And if the urine is not dissolved, and the retention of it is to be by stone which is already in the neck of the bladder, then it is necessary that the patient be bent over his knees.
E aprop conponeys les pes de aquel sobre le sieu dos e extendas le sieu ventre de la partida pus desus del sieu dos, e le malaute estrengua le sieu ale tant quant es a lu possible.	And then place the feet of that one upon his buttocks and extend his belly from the part higher up from his buttocks, and the patient strains his bowels as much as is possible to him.
Donc lahoras le col de la vesica es costreyt ha espulsio de la peyra a las partidas detras, per que la urina es absolta.	Therefore then the neck of the bladder is constricted to the expulsion of the stone to the parts behind, so that the urine is absolved.
E si no es dissolvuda am aquo que havem dit he vehement es fayta la causa sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que aministres extraccio de lu am instrument le qual es apelat siringua, del qual aquesta es la forma: Sia de argent e sia subtil leon conquau, ayssi cum canula de pena de ausel am subtilitat de ray lonc en similitut d’un palm e mig, al qual sia cana subtil en le cap de lu.	And if it is not dissolved with the water that we have said and vehemently is made the cause upon the patient, then it is necessary that you administer extraction from him with an instrument which is called a syringe, of which this is the shape: It is of silver and is a subtle cone, as well as a tube of bird's feather with the subtlety of a long ray in similarity of a palm and a half, to which there is a subtle cane in the head of it.
E la manieyra del eyssiment de la urina per aquel es que prenguas le fiel doblat e lies en la extramitat de lu lana o coto per bona liadura; e entrometas las extramitatz del fiel en la partida dejos de la ciringua, e inscideys am las forfexs si superflueys alcuna causa de la lana, mays intromet la en la canula am vehemencia E aprop enongeys la ciringua am boder e am album de huou.	And the manner of the eyssiment of the urine by that one is that you take the double knot and tie it in the middle of it wool or cloth for good binding; and introduce the extremities of the knot in the part below of the syringe, and cut with the forceps if superfluously any cause of the wool, but introduce it into the tube with vehemence and then engage the syringe with border and with album of hog.
E fay cezer le malaute sobre la selha, e embroca la vesiqua de lu e la vergua am olis umitz, e oli de oliva e ayguaros.	And make the patient lie on the shelf, and embrocate his bladder and groin with oiled, olive oil and water.
E aprop entromet la ciringua am facilitat entro que pervengua a la razit de la vergua; e aprop dobla la vergua desus a la partida del embelic; e aprop empelleys la ciringua dintz aquela; e aprop empelleys aquela entro que pervengua a la vesica, e aquela centa le malaute esser pervenguda a la causa vuoda, e no es fayt asso segon aquest orde, sino le meat en le qual va a tortuositat.	And then introduce the syringe with facility until it reaches the root of the groin; and then double the groin above the part of the navel; and then push the syringe into that; and then push it until it reaches the bladder, and that centa the patient be reached to the cause void, and it is not made according to this order, but the meat in which it goes to tortuousity.
E aprop exten le fiel am la lana petit a petit, quar la urina siec la lana.	And then extend the knot with the wool little by little, so that the urine seeps into the wool.
Aprop extratz aquela e fay per curacio urina, e usa ciringua, no cesses fer aquo e usa ciringua entro que sia evacuada la vesica e le malaute atrobe alleviacio.	Then extract that and make for cure urine, and use syringe, do not cease to do water and use syringe until the bladder is evacuated and the patient returns to relief.
Capitol .lix.	Chapter .lix.
De qualitat de clisterizacio de la vezica am clampcedra e am semblantz instrumentz les quals sian acordants ad aquo.	Of the quality of clysterization of the bladder with clampcedra and with similar instruments which are agreeable to water.
Quan accideys en la vesica ulceracio o apostema, o sanc congilat en aquela, o es coartat poyredura, e vols en aquela destillar ayguas e medicinas, lahoras sia fayt am instrument le qual es apelat clampcedra, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When accidents in the bladder ulceration or abscess, or congealed blood in that, or is constricted by a wound, and you want in that to distill waters and medicines, then it is made with an instrument which is called a clampcedra, and this is the shape of it:
sino que en la extramitat de lu es sorda, so es clausa.	But in the extremity of it is blunt, so it is closed.
Et en aquela so tres traucs: dos de la una partida , ayssi quo vezes.	And in that there are three straps: two on one side, as many times.
En le comensament es loc concau, en le qual es aquo que es enpellit, e sia segon quantitat que oppile aquel, ses addicio, entro que quan alcuna causa es ab aquel tirada de las humiditatz, sia atirada, e quan es expellida, am aquo sia atirada, e quan es expellit lonc, segon que fa clampcedra am la qual es phicat naphta en las batalhas de mar.	At the beginning it is concave, in which is that which is filled, and as much as it fills, its addition, until when any cause is drawn from those humidities, it is drawn, and when it is expelled, with it it is drawn, and when it is expelled long, according to what is done with a clamp used to pick up naphtha in the battles of the sea.
Donc cum tu vols prohicir humiditatz en la vesica, entromet la extremitat de clapcedra en la humiditat, e atira am aquel aquo que es empellit a las partidas desus, quar la humiditat es atirada en la conquavitat de clapcedra.	Therefore, as you want to prohibit humidities in the bladder, introduce the extremity of the clamp into the humidity, and pull with it that which is filled to the upper parts, because the humidity is drawn into the concavity of the clamp.
E aprop entromet la extramitat de clapcedra en la vergua segon que havem recomtat en la ciringua; e aprop empelleys la humiditat am aquo que empelleys, quar aquela humiditat perve a la vesica tantost, e le malaute cent aquela.	And then introduce the extremity of the clamp into the vagina as we have recounted in the tongue; and then pull the humidity with it, because that humidity goes to the bladder immediately, and the patient feels that.
Forma del cristeri subtil am le qual la vesica es cristerizada, e es aquela la forma:	Form of the subtle cristeri with which the bladder is cristerized, and it is that form:
E sia fayta de argent o de lato, de la qual le cap pus aut sia semblant a petita pluma, e dejos lu cana dedintz liament.	And it is made of silver or of laton, of which the head is more or less like a small feather, and below it a canal is made inside it.
E aprop pren vesica de moto, e pausa en aquela la humiditat que vols cristirizar en la vesica, e aprop lia aquela entre dos am fort liguatura am fiel doble, e escalfa aquela humiditat sobre le foc.	And then take the bladder of the patient, and place in it the humidity that you want to cristerize in the bladder, and then tie that between two with a strong double ligament, and heat that humidity over the fire.
E aprop entromet la extremitat del cristeri en la vergua.	And then introduce the extremity of the cristeri into the vagina.
E aprop estrenh la tua ma sobre la vesica am la humiditat am strectura descent entro que·l malaute centa que aquela humiditat ja es pervenguda a la vesica.	And then stretch your hand over the bladder with the humidity with structure descent until the patient feels that that humidity has already reached the bladder.
Mays si a tu no es present vesica, lahoras tu pren una pessa de parguames e fay de aquel cercle; e perfora aquel de tota la sua retonditat; e aprop entromet fiel fort en aquels traucs, ayssi quo so revolgut; e aprop agregua le cercle ayssi quo es agreguat alsofatur, pus que tu pausas en aquel aquo que tu vols de las humiditatz, e olis e ayguas.	But if you do not have a bladder, then you take a piece of parchment and make a circle from it; and perforate it with all its roundness; and then introduce a strong thread into those holes, so that it is rolled; and then add the circle so that it is joined to the sofatur, because you put in it the water that you want of the humidities, and oils and waters.
E aprop tu lia aquel en le instrument e fay am aquel ayssi cum has fayt am la vesica, e exprescio am la tua ma entro que la humiditat pervengua a la vesica.	And then you tie that on the instrument and do with it as you have done with the bladder, and express with your hand until the humidity reaches the bladder.
Capitol .lx.	Chapter .lx.
De extraccio de peyra.	Of the extraction of stone.
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.	We have already said in the division the species of stone and its cure with medicines, and the difference between stone generated in the kidneys and stone generated in the bladder, and the signs of that.
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	And we have said the stone in which catz operation with hand, and section.
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	And the stone generated in the bladder properly is that which is found in the bladder.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	And you are narrating that with manifest exposition and abbreviation.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	Therefore, I say that stone generated in the bladder mostly comes to children; and of the signs of it is that the urine that is excreted from the bladder is similar to water in its subtlety, and appears in it sand; and the patient feels his vagina, and many times it hurts, and then it is dressed; and with that, the anus feels like many of those.
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	And it is easier the healing of children of that than those who have reached fourteen years; and it is difficult cure in the old.
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	But in the young it is easier because it is between those.
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And of that one in which the stone is larger and the cure is easier; And if it is little, it is contrary to that.
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	Therefore, as we come to the cure of that, we must at the beginning of that which we modify the patient with the cristeri which extracts all the fissure which is in their bowels; because that fissure sometimes prohibits the entrance of the stone from the vesica, and the investigation of it.
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas.	And then place the patient on their feet and make them sit and lie down so that the stone descends to the neck of the bladder, or which jumps from the place or sometimes.
E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos.	And then make that censer between your hands prepared, and the hands of it are below the things of it, so that the bladder is entirely made declining to the lower parts.
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	And then pierce that and all that through.
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	Therefore, if you feel the stone in the space, then you cut immediately with section over it.
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if you do not catch all of it from below your touch, then you must that you anoint with oil your said index of the left hand, if the patient is a child, or the said middle if it is a young complete, and introduce that into their anus.
E perquier de la peyra entro que stia dejos le tieu dit.	And pierce of the stone until it is below your said.
E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	And convert that little by little into the neck of the bladder.
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	And then press on that with your said, and expel that to the outside parts of where you made the section.
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio.	And command the minister to press the bladder with his hand; and command another minister that with his right hand extend the genitals to the upper parts, and with his other hand re-massage the cord which is below the genitals, in the part of the place where the section is made.
E aprop entromet espatum be inscident del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then introduce a spatula well incident of which this is the form of it:
e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	And split in him what is between the anus and the genitals, not in the middle place, push to the left side of the groin; and the incision should be on that bone and your finger should be in the anus, and make a transverse incision, so that the incision outside should be wide and inside narrow according to the quantity that comes out of the bone to him as possible, and no more, because very hard compresses your finger which is in the anus the bone should the incision, and is forced-thrown its functionality.
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And know that of the bone there is some to which its angle and margins are, so that the incision of it is made difficult by this.
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	And of that what is like a gland, and it is round, and it is made of it light incision.
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	Therefore if it is that one to which its angles and margins are, adjust it in the fissure.
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	And if it is not thus forced-thrown, then cover that you engage on that, or that you hold on that with a decent gesture, the extremity of which is like a file with which you hold on the bone, and do not escape from it; or that you introduce after it a subtle instrument of curved extremity.
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	But if you cannot on that, then you enlarge the track a little, and if you see flux of blood, cut off on strong that with vitriol trissat.
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.	But if the bone is more than one, then at the beginning you push your hand to the mouth of the bladder, and then you cut on it; and then push a little on that; and similarly do so if there are more than two.
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	And if it is a very large bone, then ignorance is that you cut that with a large incision, because it happens to the patient one of two causes: or that it dies or that it endows him with a continuous distillation of urine, because of that the place is not of all consolidated.
Mays aministra expulcio de lu entro que sia fora-getada, o engenia en la fractura de lu am las forfexs entro que extragua aquela en pessas.	But administer expulsion of it while it is forced-thrown, or engineer in the fracture of it with the forceps until you extract that in pieces.
Donc cum tu auras cumplit la tua opperacio, lahoras omple la plagua de enses de aloe e de sanc de drago, e strenh aquel.	Therefore, when you have completed your operation, then fill the wound with poultices of aloe and dragon's blood, and strengthen that.
E pausa sobre aquel drap enfus en oli e vi, o en oli rozat e aygua frega, per so que apostema caut sia cedat.	And place on that cloth soaked in oil and wine, or in rubbed oil and water, so that the abscess may be ceded.
E aprop resupina le malaute sobre le sieu col, e no deslias le liament entro al tertz dia.	And then turn the patient on his back, and do not untie the bandage until the third day.
E cum aquel auras desliat, embroca le loc am aygua e mot oli, e aprop cura aquel am enguent diafinicon e am enguent diabazilicon entro que sia sanat.	And when you have untied that, embrocate the place with water and a little oil, and then cure that with a diaphaniacon gargle and a diazilicon gargle until it is healed.
Mays si en la plagua accideys apostema caut, adhust e corrosiu, e de aquel semblantz ayssi cum si le sanc es en la vesica congelat, e per lu es la hurina prohibida (e aquo es conogut per la egressio del sanc am urina), a donc entromet lo tieu dit en la plagua e extratz aquel sanc, quar si roman provoca la vesica a corropcio de la vesica e de lu putrefaccio.	But if in the wound happens a  caut, adherent and corrosive abscess, and of that semblance as if the blood is in the bladder frozen, and for that the urine is prohibited (and this is known by the egress of blood in urine), then introduce your finger into the wound and extract that blood, because if it remains it provokes the bladder to corruption of the bladder and of it putrefaction.
E aprop lava la plagua am vi agre, aygua e sal, e am opposicio a tota specia, am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then wash the wound with vinegar, water and salt, and in opposition to all species, with that which you convene to it of the cure until it is healed.
E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	And cover in the hours of all the cure that you lie both things and adjust the medicines which are laid on the place.
E si la peyra es petita e es en le meat de la vergua, e es ficat en lu, e eyssement de urina es prohibit, lahoras cura aquel am aquo que yeu recomti denant que pervenguas a seccio, quar tropas veguadas per aquesta curacio yest acusat de seccio; e ja yeu e esproat aquo, e es que tu prenguas un perforador de ferr alfelut, del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if the bone is small and is in the middle of the thigh, and it is stuck in it, and the emission of urine is prohibited, then cure that with the water that I recommended before you reach incision, because troops accustomed by this cure are accused of incision; and I have already spoken of this, and it is that you take a perforator of felt iron, of which this is the shape of it:
de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	of triangular extremity, sharp, stuck in a shaft.
E aprop pren fiel, e lia am aquel la vergua dejos la peyra per so que no retorne a la vesica.	And then take a thread, and tie with it the thigh below the bone so that it does not return to the bladder.
E aprop entromet le ferr en la vergua, perforant am fecilitat entro que·l perforador vengua ad aquela peyra.	And then introduce the iron into the thigh, perforating with facility until the perforator comes to that bone.
E revolveys le perforador am la tua ma en aquela peyra petit a petit, e tu perforsa la perforacio de lu entro que fassas aquel del autra part penetrar; quar la urina tantost es absolta.	And revolve the perforator with your hand in that small bone little by little, and you perforate the perforation of it until you make that of the other part penetrate; because the urine is immediately released.
E aprop prem la tua ma sobre aquo que es romas de la peyra de la partida deforo de la vergua, quar aquela es trinquada, e es foro-getada am la urina, e le malaute es sanat.	And then press your hand on that which is broken of the bone from the side outside of the thigh, because that is stuck, and is forced-thrown with the urine, and the patient is healed.
Mays si aquesta curacio no es a tu aparelhada per alcuna causa la qual prohibeys de aquela, lahoras lia un fiel dejos la peyra, e autra fiel desus la peyra.	But if this cure is not to your apparatus for any cause which prohibits you from that, then tie a thread below the bone, and another thread above the bone.
E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.	And then cut on the bone in that thigh between two ligatures.
E aprop extratz aquela.	And then extract that.
E aprop deslia le liament e mondifica le sanc congilat, le qual es fayt en la plagua.	And then untie the ligament and modify the congealed blood, which is made in the wound.
E no es necessari liament de fiel dejos la peyra, sino per que no retorne a la vesica, e l’autre liament desus sino, quar quan es desliat le fiel aprop la egrecio de la peyra, la codena retorna a son loc e cobra la plagua.	And it is not necessary a ligament of thread below the bone, but only so that it does not return to the bladder, and the other ligament above, because when the thread is untied the egress of the bone, the coda returns to its place and covers the wound.
E per aquo es a tu necessari quan lias le fiel desus, que tu eleves la codena a las partidas desus, o que retorne deves le tieu compliment, e cobra la plagua ayssi co havem dit.	And for that it is necessary to you when you tie the thread above, that you elevate the coda to the parts above, or that it returns you must fulfill your compliment, and covers the wound as we have said.
Capitol .lxi.	Chapter LXl.
De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	Of the extraction of a stone from women.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	Stones in women are rarely produced.
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	But if a stone is found in any of them, then its cure is difficult, and it is prohibited by many methods.
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	One of them is that the woman must be very much a virgin.
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	And the second is that you do not find a woman well-informed who describes herself to the doctor when she is chaste, or is of the women having husbands.
La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	The third is that you do not find a woman well-knowing this art, especially the operation with the hand.
E la quarta es que·l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor.	And the fourth is that the place of the incision over a stone in women is distant from the place of the stone, because you indiges of a pre-wound incision, and in that one is fear.
Mays si necessitat provoca a tu ad aquo, lahoras cove que tu prenguas una femna metga be scient, e pauc es atrobada.	But if necessity provokes you to it, then you must take a woman doctor well-knowing, and few are found.
Mays si tu es privat de aquela, lahoras cerca metga quast e subtil, o presenta una femna matrona be esenhada en le feyt de las femnas, o femna que en aquesta art ennueys partida del art.	But if you are deprived of that, then seek a doctor who is skilled and subtle, or present a woman matron well-versed in the ways of women, or a woman who in this art is part of the art.
Donc fay aquela present, e comanda a lu que fassa tot aquo que tu li mandaras, de la enquisicio sobre la peyra al comensament; la qual causa es que reguarde si la femna es verges, lahoras cove que meta lo sieu dit en le cul de lu e quiera la peyra.	Therefore, do that present, and command him to do everything that you tell him, from the inquiry about the stone to the beginning; the reason for this is that he should regard if the woman is a virgin, then he must put his finger in her anus and want the stone.
Donc si atroba aquela, coarte aquela dejos le sieu dit, e lahoras comanda a lu que inscida sobre aquela.	Therefore, if he finds that, force that from her, and then command him to insert it.
Mays si no es verge, lahoras comanda a la matrona que entrometa lo sieu dit en le conh de la malauta e enquiera sobre la peyra, pus que pausa la sua ma sinistra sobre la vesica, e comprem aquela am bona comprecio.	But if she is not a virgin, then command the matron to insert her finger into the vagina of the patient and inquire about the stone, because she places her left hand over the bladder, and comprehends that with good understanding.
Donc si atroba aquela, lahoras cove que gradantment maugua aquela de l’orrifici de la vesica a las partidas dejos am somman de la sua vertut entro que pervengua am aquel a la razit de la coyssa.	Therefore, if she finds it, then she must gradually withdraw it from the orifice of the bladder to the parts below with the sum of her virtue until it reaches the root of the vagina.
E aprop inscida sobre aquela apposicio de la maytat del conh deves la razit de la coyssa de qualque part sia a lu parada e cent la peyra en aquela partida, e·l dit de lu no sia remaugut de la peyra coartan dejos lu.	And then insert it again over that position of the majority of the vagina to the root of the vagina, of whatever part it is stopped, and the stone in that part, and the finger of it not be withdrawn from the stone, short of it.
E la seccio sia pauca al comensament; e aprop entrometa lo ray sobre aquela seccio, e si sent la peyra, lahoras ajuste en seccio segon la quantitat la qual sap que la peyra sira getada de aquela.	And the incision be little at the beginning; and then insert the ray over that incision, and if he feels the stone, then adjust in incision according to the quantity which he knows that the stone is cast from that.
E sapias que las specias de peyra son motas: quar de aquelas es pauca e gran, e leon e aspra, e longua e redonda, e havent ramps.	And know that the species of stones are many: for some are small and large, and lion and sharp, and long and round, and having ramps.
Donc tu sapias quantas specias so de lu per aquo que tu signifiques sobre aquo que vols.	Therefore, you know how many species are of it by what you signify about what you want.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, ajusta en le loc vetriol trissat e te aquela per una hora entro que sia abscindit le sanc, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	And if you see a flow of blood, adjust in the place vitriol trissat and put that for an hour until the blood is abstained, and then return to your operation until the stone is cast out.
E fay que prepares am tu dels instrumentz les quals e ditz en la extraccio de peyra en les homes, per so que sias ajudat per aquels en la tua operacio.	And do that you prepare with you of the instruments the ones which are said in the extraction of stones in men, so that you may be helped by those in your operation.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, e sabes que la expulcio del sanc es de la arceria que es insciza, lahoras tu pausa polvera sobre le loc e estrenh aquel am pulvils e strictura descent, e no iteras aquo; e layssa la peyra e no extraguas aquela, quar fort leu morira la malauta.	And if you see a flow of blood, and know that the expulsion of blood is from the artery that is incised, then you put powder over the place and strengthen it with pills and stricture descent, and do not repeat that; and leave the stone and do not extract it, for very likely the woman will die.
E aprop cura la plagua.	And then cure the wound.

E cerqua am les tieus ditz que lay no sia alcuna causa del budel envelopat en le ciphac blanc dur.	And seek with your fingers that there be no cause of the intestine enveloped in the white hard scalp.
Mays si tu atrobas de lu alcuna causa, lahoras tu enpelleys aquel al ventre dejos.	But if you find of it any cause, then you peel that to the belly after.
E aprop tu pren una agulha en la qual sia fiel gros fayt de x fiels, e entromet aquel deves le derier del ciphac, le qual es jos la codena dels testicols, la qual siec seccio; e aprop inscideys las extremitatz las quals emineysso del fiel entro que sian quatre fiels, e aprop compausa alcus de lor sobre alcuna figura en manieyra de crotz; e lia am aquel le ciphac del qual havem dit que es dejos la codena dels testicols am fort liament de dos partz.	And then you take a needle in which be thick thread made of x threads, and introduce that through the back of the scalp, which is below the cord of the testicles, which seizes the section; and then cut the extremities which emerge from the thread until they are four threads, and then compose some of them on some figure in the manner of a cross; and tie with that the scalp of which we have said that is after the cord of the testicles with strong binding of two parts.
E aprop envolveys las extremitatz dels fiels e lia aquelas am liament vehement entro que alcu dels vayssels que noyrrisso aquels no puscan trametre alcuna causa per so que de aqui no accida apostema caut.	And then wrap the extremities of the threads and tie those with vehement binding so that some of the vessels that nourish those cannot transmit any cause so that from here no abscess occur afterwards.
E pausa autra veguada liament segon foro le primier liament, lonh de lu mens tres ditz; e aprop aquestz dos liaments layssa del ciphac le qual es dejos la codena dels testicols la quantitat de la grandeza del dit, e inscideys tot le romanent segon redondeza, e osta de lu le huou.	And pause another binding according to the first binding, long from it less three fingers; and then these two bindings leave of the scalp which is after the cord of the testicles the quantity of the greatness of the finger, and cut all the remaining according to roundness, and take out of it the huou.
E aprop inscideys en la partida dejos de la codena dels testicols per seccio de la qual corra sanc e sania ayssi cum havem recomtat en aquo que havem dit.	And then cut in the part after the cord of the testicles by section of which blood runs and heals thus as we have recommended in that which we have said.
E aprop aministra lana submersa en oli, e pausa en la plagua; e aministra le liament le qual havem recomtat (e alcunas veguadas le ciphac blanc es cauterizat, le qual havem dit aprop la inscizio de lu temen de flux de sanc, quar motas veguadas accideys aquels) e leyssa le liament entro que per si caia.	And then administer wool immersed in oil, and place it on the wound; and administer the binding which we have recommended (and sometimes the white scalp is cauterized, which we have said near the incision fear of blood flow, because many times those occur) and leave the binding until by itself it falls.
Mays si le cazement de lu es tardat, lahoras de aygua cauda sia embrocat, e pausa sobre aquel entro que caia segon que havem dit.	But if the hunting of it is late, then of hot water be embroiled, and place it on that until it falls as we have said.
E aprop cura la plagua am l’autra curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the wound with the other cure of wounds until it be healed.
Capitol .lxvi.	Chapter .lxvi.
De hernia ventosa.	Of a Wind Hernia.
En aquesta hernia no e vist alcu que sia estat ardit sus la curacio de lu am ferr.	In this hernia no one has been seen that has been dared on the cure of it with iron.
E les primiers diyssero que es fayta ayssi cum havem recomtat en la hernia que es am vi; la qual es que tu lies les vayssels aprop la seccio sobre aquela am fecilitat de lu; e aprop secca en le mieg loc en enviro le apostema am aquo que obro aquel, entro que caian les vayssels.	And the first ones said that it is made as we have recommended in the hernia that is with vi; which is that you tie the vessels near the section over that with facility of it; and then dry in the middle place around the abscess with that which opened it, until the vessels fall.
E cura la plagua segon que havem dit entro que sia sanada.	And cure the wound as we have said until it be healed.
Capitol .lxvii.	Chapter .lxvii.
De la disropcio que es fayta en les anguonars.	Of the Disruption that is Made in the Anvils.
Alcunas veguadas endeve ruptura en les angonars ayssi cum havem dit, e emineys le loc.	Sometimes there happens a rupture in the anvils as we have said, and emerge the place.
E no deyssen als genetius alcuna causa dels budels al genetius; e si deyssen, aquo es pauc; e retorna s’en en totas horas.	And do not let the genitals any cause of the intestines to the genitals; and if they let, that is little; and return it in all hours.
Mays si es prolonguat le temps am aquo, es ajustada fissura en le ciphac entro que deysenda le budel en le ciphac; e accideys aquo per la extencio del ciphac le qual es en le angonars ayssi cum havem dit, la qual causa es quar le ciphac es estendut, e aprop es mollificat e·l loc es apostemat e emineys.	But if the time is prolonged with that, a fissure is adjusted in the scalp until the intestine descends into the scalp; and this happens by the extension of the scalp which is in the anvils as we have said, the cause of which is that the scalp is extended, and then it is softened and the place is abscesses and emerges.
E la cura de lu es am cauteri ayssi quo es precedida la narracio de lu.	And the care of him is with cautery as narrated before.
E alcunas veguadas es curada am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: e es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos entre las tuas mas, e aprop secca le loc de la ruptura dels apostemas emineys am seccio per la latitut segon la quantitat de tres ditz.	And sometimes it is cured with iron in this manner: and the patient lies on his two hands between his legs, and then the place of the rupture of the emerging abscesses is dried with a section along the width according to the quantity of three fingers.
E aprop strenh le ciphac blanc que es jos la codena entro que sia descubert.	And then tighten the white bandage that is under the loincloth until it is uncovered.
E aprop pren le ray e pausa aquel sobre le loc eminent del ciphac, e prem aquel al preon del ventre.	And then take the ray and place it on the prominent place of the bandage, and press it to the navel of the belly.
E aprop cus le dos locs eminentz sobre la extremitat del ray del ciphac, e ajusta am la sutura un de aquels am l’autre.	And then stitch the two prominent places on the end of the bandage ray, and adjust with the suture one of them with the other.
E aprop extratz la extremitat del ray, e no inscidas del ciphac de tot, ni no extenda le huou, ni autra causa ayssi cum yeu te fi saber en la curacio de hernia entestinal.	And then extract the end of the ray, and do not cut the bandage entirely, nor extend the wound, nor any other cause as you have learned in the cure of intestinal hernia.
E aprop cura aquela am la curacio de las plaguas, e cum inscideyses les fiels, mundifica aquela e restaura la plagua entro que sia consolidada; quar le ciphac es contrayt e no es ajustada la eminencia de ruptura.	And then cure that with the cure of the wounds, and as you cut the threads, purify that and restore the wound while it is consolidated; for the bandage is contracted and the prominence of the rupture is not adjusted.
E cauteri es milhor en aquest loc, quar es pus propda a salut.	And cautery is better in this place, for it is more proper to health.
Capitol .lxviii.	Chapter .lxviii.
De mollificacio de la codena dels testiculs.	Of the softening of the scrotum.
Motas veguadas la codena dels testiculs en alcus homes es mollificada per aysso quar las carns que so entre aquela son mollificadas, e es fedat le reguardament de lu.	Many times the scrotum of some men is softened because the flesh that is between it is softened, and it is fed by the regard of it.
Adonc necessari es ad aquel que es preguat en la curacio de lu que fassa jazer le malaute segon le sieu dos, e enscida tota la codena la qual es mollificada sobre la codena natural; e aprop que ajuste doas labias am la sutura.	Therefore, it is necessary for him who is asked in the cure of it that he make the patient lie on his two hands, and cut all the scrotum which is softened over the natural scrotum; and then that he adjust the two lips with the suture.
E si vols, cus en le comensament la superfluitat de la codena mollificada am tres cozeduras o quatre e am ferma sutura.	And if you want, sew at the beginning the superfluity of the softened scrotum with three stitches or four and with firm suture.
E aprop inscideys entre las suturas; e aprop cura per curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat e caian les fiels.	And then cut between the sutures; and then cure by the cure of the other wounds until it is healed and the threads fall.
Capitol .lxix.	Chapter .lxix.
De castracio.	Of castration.
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias.	Know that castration in our law is forbidden, but for cause it is written to me that I remember it in this book; and it is not necessary to remember it except for two ways, of which one is so that it is in the knowledge of the doctor when he is asked about it, that he knows the cure of it to whom it happens; and the other way is that many times we have need of castration of other animals for our benefits, as for those, as for goats, and for sheep, and for pigs, and for similar animals.
E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	And therefore I say that castration is done in two ways: either by attrition, or by fissure to section.
Mays en aquela que es fayta per atrissio, la via de la opera es que nos fassam cezer la bestia en aygua cauda entro que·ls genetius de lu sian mollificatz e sian linhitz e que pendan.	But in that which is done by attrition, the way of the operation is that we make the beast to be cut in hot water while its genitals are softened and are limp and that they hang.
E aprop pren aquels am la tua ma entro que sian resols e no apparescan dejos le tocament.	And then take those with your hand while they are resolved and do not appear after the touch.
Mays en castracio fayta per fissura e seccio, cove que tu tenguas la bestia e premas la codena dels testicols de lu am la ma senestra.	But in castration done by fissure and section, when you have the beast and press the scrotum of it with your left hand.
E aprop lia le suspensori, e inscideys sobre quascun huou am una seccio entro que dos huous proceseysso.	And then lift the suspensor, and cut over each testicle with a section between two testicles processed.
E aprop inscideys aquels pus que auras quascu excorjat.	And then cut those as much as you will have each excoriated.
E no leysses sobre aquels del ciphac alcuna causa, sino le ciphac subtil le qual es sobre les vazes.	And do not leave on those of the bandage any cause, but the fine bandage which is over the veins.
E aquesta manieyra de castracio es milhor la qual es fayta per atrissio, quar atrissio fort leu layssa alcuna causa dels testicols per que la bestia desira coyt.	And this manner of castration is better the one which is done by attrition, for attrition firmly leaves no cause of the testicles for which the beast desires coyt.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And then cure the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lxx.	Chapter .lxx.
De la cura de hermafrodozia.	Of the cure of hermaphroditism.
Hermafrodozia en les homes es segon dos manieyras: la una es quar o appar en aquo que siec l’espazi en la codena de testiculs, en aquel que es entre dos testiculs figura quar cunh de femna en la qual so pels.	Hermaphroditism in men is according to two ways: one is that it appears in that which separates the space in the scrotum of testicles, in that which is between two testicles figures as a cunh of woman in which it is.
E alcunas veguadas de aquel corr urina le qual es en la codena dels testiculs.	And sometimes from that comes urine the which is in the scrotum of the testicles.
Mays en las femnas es una specia: e es que·l conh de la femna sobre le pentenilh es ayssi cum dos testiculs de home un pauc de tot yminiheys a la partida deforo ayssi cum le perpucii de home e dos testicols.	But in women it is a species: and it is that the cunh of the woman over the pentalith is as two testicles of a man a little of all diminished at the front part as well as the prepuce of a man and two testicles.
E la curacio es de tres specias: de dos dels homes e de una specia de las femnas.	And the cure is of three species: of two of the men and of one species of the women.
E es que cove que tu inscidas aquelas carns ajustadas entro que efuga la emprecio de aquela, e aprop que cures aquelas am curacio de las autras plaguas.	And it is that when you cut those adjusted flesh while it effuses the impregnation of it, and then that you cure those with the cure of the other wounds.
E en la segonda specia dels homes de la qual yeys urina la qual es en la codena dels testiculs, no es curacio ni opperacio en lu.	And in the second species of men of which yeys urine the which is in the scrotum of the testicles, there is no cure nor operation in it.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter .xxi.
De lentinge e de carn eminent per causas de las femnas.	Of lenting and of prominent flesh for causes of the women.
