Forma de inscisori autra minor:	Shape of another smaller chisel:
Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	Shape of another chisel; this one resembling a chisel, and the extremity of it is like a saw, and it is exhibited in many places in the ratio of the bones:
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	Shape of a chisel which is convenient for the ratio of that which is perforated of the bones:
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And the extremity of it is triangular and of acute extremity.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian iron, and similarly as all the causes that we have said of razors and chisels and saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of incision extremities and the serration of the bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities can be cut either by intrinsic cause or by extrinsic cause, or as you will have medicated that corruption by cure of those medicines and the cure does not confer, or sometimes the corruption goes away from the limb which you do not strike by any cause, then you must cut that limb into that which the corruption is, so that the patient escapes by that of death or of malice which is a greater defect of the limb.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of that to whom it happens, is that the limb is made black before it is cured that fire has already burned it, or it can be said that the blackness is near before the putrefaction of that one enters into that limb that it seizes it and that it nourishes the whole body; and therefore, you must cut it.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly if it is a cause of corruption by percussion of some venomous causes, such as a scorpion of the sea or a viper or a rutela and similar ones.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or the percussion is in the extremity of the finger, then you cut the finger and do not give space to the corruption so that it enters into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly if it reaches the hand, then you cut it from the root of the wrist, and do not give space to the corruption so that it nourishes in the wrist of the arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if instead of that, then you cut the arm into the armpit at the junction.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if instead of that, the corruption passes and sometimes it surrounds the armpit, then in that is the death of the patient; and to administer another cause another to that in cure is a quantity of virtue.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly do of the foot when corruption replaces the toe of the foot, then you cut it into one of the joints.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it takes hold in the arch of the foot, then you cut the whole foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it reaches into the thigh, then you cut the leg into the junction of the thigh.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already reached the thigh, then in it there is no remedy but dismissal, and leave the patient to death.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the manner of cutting the limb or of sawing it is that you strengthen the ligament in the part furthest from where you want to cut, and strengthen another ligament over the place; and extend the minister a ligament to the parts below, and extend the minister another ligament above; and you separate the flesh which is between two ligaments, so that it is like a spatula until all the flesh is uncovered; and then cut or saw.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And that it be laid cloth of linen from all parts so that it does not touch the place itself, and that it comes to the patient the lesion adjusted and abscess cauter.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if blood flows when you work, then cauterize the area carefully, or place some powders on it to restrain the blood; and then return to your treatment before it is completed.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bind the affected limb with a bandage as convenient, and care for it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I recommend to you what happens to a man in his foot, this same accident which I have told you, which is when blackness occurs in his foot with a burning that was assembled like the burning of fire.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption occurs first in his toe before it spreads throughout his entire foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that man prepares for himself to put pus that he might feel the cure going to the limb with the violence of it that throbs with pain and burning, and the ulcer spreads into the joint, and fire heals.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	For a long time that same corruption occurs in the toe of the hand that I have indicated.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then it comes to me, and I am pierced to feel that superfluity with what I place on the hand of the medicines, and then the purification of his body; and the superfluity does not return and it begins to go to the other toe before it begins in the hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And he begs me to cut his hand, and I do not want to do that, hoping for the repercussion of that superfluity, and more than that, I fear that the incision of his hand will be dead, because the virtue of the sickness was over the killing.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And since he despaired of me, he returned to his land, and it came to me that that man prepared and cut his hand entirely, and he was healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have not added this narration except so that it may be helpful regarding what happens to this illness, and that its meaning be known and according to which it be treated.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Of the cure of sinews and the quality of clysterization with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs in some fleshy members and the space of the abscess is prolonged until it makes a collection of pus, and then it is ruptured and perforated, and pus is discharged from it, and the place remains empty like it was a vessel, and the skin that is above it is as fine as cloth, and it has not reached the back corruption, and it has not imprinted on the bone or on the nerves or on the ligament, it is called a sinus, and it is not called a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	But however, if the space is prolonged until the corruption imprints on some member, then it is called a fistula and not a sinus.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the cure of it is that the skin is incised entirely as it is revolved, and mostly when it is fine and made like cloth, and it is cauterized so that it does not adhere to the place because of its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	But if you hope that the skin adheres and that that corruption has not achieved further consequence, and in the skin there has passed through a face, then you cure that with clysters.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And it is that you consider the sinus, and then if it is large, and the brac that you see is of a fetid odor, then you clysterize that with an Egyptian medicine which is of oil and wine and ginger receiving equal parts, and they are placed in a vessel, and they are boiled over the fire until the medicine becomes thick and reaches the consistency of honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And then you take from it what is necessary and dissolve it in water and honey; and clysterize with that the sinus, and strengthen the orifice of it, and leave the medicine in it for the quantity of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And then you extract that with a spoon; and do this for so many days until the sinus is purified and the stench is removed.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And sometimes it is clysterized with ash water, when you do not have this medicine present; and it is that you take the ash of vitz, and put water on it; and then you collect that and clysterize with it until you confess that the sinus is then healed.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the illness does not tolerate the Egyptian medicine nor the ash water, then clysterize that with water and honey and a little crushed ginger, and clysterize that with wine and honey mixed, because of the property of honey is that it purifies and washes, and the wine makes the sinus adhere, and especially when the wine has an excess of astringency and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And as you do this sometimes and you confess that the sinus is already healed, then clysterize that with water that makes flesh grow in it.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And it is that you take of the dyphthenon and dissolve it in rose oil and astringent wine; or that you clysterize with some medicines and other gargles that have the properties which I have already written in the treatise of gargles.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the orifice of the sinus is narrow in which the clyster nozzle is not received, then you enlarge it with a small iron little by little, and place in it a poultice wrapped in Egyptian ointment or basilicon ointment until it is enlarged.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And similarly if the orifice is wide, then you add the lips of it with suture and leave it for the quantity in which between the clyster its addition.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the orifice from which the pus flows is elevated to the upper parts, then dry that in the lowest place that is in it so that the pus flows downwards, because when the pus is constricted in the depth of the sinus the flesh is generated in it.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible for you to dry the sinus within the environment of the bone as low as you want, then perforate it so that you prepare the limb with the preparation by which the arm flows lightly according to what is to your apparel and that no cause of the arm be retained in it.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take consolidated medicines that are placed on the convenient sinus to that which you want to extend those on a piece of cloth.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the cloth be of such a great quantity as it makes the communication of the whole sinus; and then cut with the shears in the right of the orifice of the sinus a furrow wider a little than the orifice of the sinus; and then extend over another cloth of the lions' entrails according to the quantity of the furrow, and place it over it in a distant position from the orifice of the sinus so that the emission of the arm from it be alleviated and do not show the large cloth except after a few days once.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	May that which is over the orifice of the sinus, which you remove every hour so that what is adjusted in it of the arm may escape.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you know if what flows from the arm is much or little, or is digested, or is undigested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And thus you consider the place of that sinus, if in it the patient feels pain or not, and if there is an abscess in it.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And as your medication is prolonged in this manner, and you see the matter that is thrown over the orifice of the sinus already adheres, or approaches adhesion, then you may remove it on the third day, and when you remove the patch, then change the cloth for another and renew the poultice.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if from the sinus a little space away there are subtle viruses, then do not despair of their adhesion, for the healing of it approaches, for there are some men in whom the generation of flesh in their wounds is slow, and of those it is done the contrary.

De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	Of section above the pain nafir.

E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And I have already seen it as I will tell you.

E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And then I recommended to myself that I should turn it all over her body as I saw; and it was too marvelous of the permutation of it and the speed of member to member.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	And I had already seen this before in my own veins in that manner, however, I have seen many of which the pain being mutated from limb to limb.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	But I did not see this in the veins as in the woman.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I did not think it to be this but rather because the woman was old, or so of dry body and of exposed veins, and in this appearance at the feeling that windiness mutated.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	And it is necessary that it does not appear according to this retro-cure in those who are delicate and with moist bodies of well-fed veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And as you want the cure of it, and the patient feels that pain, then it is not to you apparent in the vein as we have said, then you strengthen over that and leave it lightly and softly over that until that windiness is constricted, and cauterize the place.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	But if you do not see it in your veins, then you cure that with expulsion of the body and with that which you expel windiness, and charms those with fetid pills and with pills of serpent and the like.
De extraccio de sagetas.	Of extraction of arrows.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows are diversified according to the species, and according to the places of the body in which they are shot, for their diversity is that of those that have large tips, and small, and concave, and blunt, so they are solid; and of those that have three angles, and of those that have tongues; and of those that have shafts.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And that which is according to the limbs and the feet in which they are shot is according to two manners: for the limbs or are principal limbs concave, as the brain, the heart, the liver, and the lung, and the bowels, and the bladder, and their likes; and therefore when it hits in one of these members and appears to you signs of death, which cause you to recommend it close, then cove that you avoid extraction of that arrow in those where death seizes that in the one in the major dispositions, and when to you do not appear these evils signs, and the arrow is not hidden in the depth of the limb, then you extract that and cure the plague.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And of the signs of the servant is when it hits in it an arrow, and it passes through the bone, and it is emitted from the cyphra which is above the brain, for it accides by it soda vehement, and scotomia, and vertigo, and roaring in the legs, and inflammation and roaring of the tongue, and spasm and permixtio of understanding and vomiting of bile, and fort leu is abscindida the word and is destroyed the voice, and it is emitted from the place of the plague humidity white resembling dust, and yeys of it resembling the liquidity of the flesh.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And therefore if these signs appear to you, then you abstain from the cure and the extraction of the arrow, if it is not outside.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	But the signs of the arrow when it hits the heart, so it is near the left nipple, and feels with that which is put in a hard cause, and it is not a void cause; and fort leu the movement of the arrow is similar to the movement of the hand, and running of the plague black blood, and seizes that coldness of the extremities, and sore cold, and syncope; and therefore know that death descends all over.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the signs when the arrow has wounded the lung so are the spitting of blood from the plague, and the vessels that are near the throat are inflamed, and the color of the patient is changed, and he expires great spirit, and demands the traction of cold air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	And if it hits the arrow in the ligament which is in the foot, and the pain then is near the small bones, and it is made the leg great with vehement pain and with sighing, and not bad all the members of the muscles.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if it hits the arrow in the stomach, then fort leu yeys of the plague food somewhat indigested.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	And if it hits the arrow in the belly, and it is put in it, yeys some wound of the plague, or the cloth, or the bowel which is dislocated, and there is no hope in the cure of it extraction of the arrow.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	And if the arrow hits the bladder, and it is emitted urine, and it processes from it some cause to the parts outside, and fort leu is pain upon the patient, then you know that it is mortal.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	But the other members as it is the face, the neck, the throat, and the shoulders and the auxiliaries, and the vertebrae of the back, and the clavicle, and the rib, and the leg and their likes of the members, are saved according to the major dispositions when the arrow does not hit vein nor artery and is not a venomous arrow.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I will recount to you what I have seen of the nature of these arrows, so that you may signify by them on your healing.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	The cause is, that in a man struck by an arrow in the lacrimal of his eye in the root of his nose, and you extracted that from the other side, leaving the gray of the eye, and it is healed, and does not hurt in the eye.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And I extracted another arrow from a Jew who was struck by it in the gray of his eye, leaving the eyelid, and the arrow was already hidden and could not be obtained from it except for a small extremity with which it adhered to its shaft, and it was a large arrow of the sharp arrows of the Turks, with a lion's head in which there were no eyes.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And the Jew healed, and did not hurt in his eye at all.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And I extracted another arrow from a Christian man who was struck by it in the throat, and it was an Arabic arrow, and it is the one that has eyes; and therefore I incised upon it between two guides, and it was already submerged in his throat; and therefore I skillfully moved it, and then extracted it, and the Christian healed.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	And I extracted another arrow from a man who was struck by it in his belly, and I thought he would die from it; and therefore, since forty days had passed and there was no change in him whatsoever from his dispositions, I incised upon the arrow and maneuvered it, and he healed, and did not hurt him at all.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	And I saw another man in whom an arrow was lodged in his back, and the wound was consolidated on him, and since it had been there for about seven years, he removed the arrow from the root of his hip.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	And I saw a woman who was struck by an arrow in her belly, and the wound was consolidated within her, and it had not changed in her dispositions in any way, and the woman did not suffer any harm in any of her natural functions.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	And I saw another man who was struck by an arrow in his face and the wound was consolidated, and he broke the arrow, not feeling much pain, and he looked quite well.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	And I extracted the arrow from the man of the king's princes who was struck in the middle of his nose, and it had already declined to the right side a little, and the whole arrow was hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And I was called to his healing after the arrow wound within three days.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	And then I examined the wound of the arrow very carefully; and then I inquired about it with a subtle probe, and I did not feel it; but I felt it prick below the right eye, and therefore I suspected that prick was because of the extremity of the arrow.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	And I plastered the place with a plaster which has attractive and digestive virtue, confessing to myself that the place would become a pustule so that it would appear to me the place of the arrow, so that it would dry up on it.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And he did not hurt in the place at all, signifying that the arrow had reached that place; and I continued with the plaster on him for many days, and he did not hurt at all; and the wound was consolidated meanwhile, and he broke the ailment of the extraction of it for a space of many days until one day he felt the arrow within his nose and recounted this to me.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	And then I placed on the wound medicine acute and corrosive for many days until it opened, and with the probe I felt it, and examined that, and retrieved the extremity of the arrow, which adhered to the shaft.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	And then I adjusted in the appearance of the wound for that acute medicine until it appeared to me visibly the extremity of the arrow, and it took me time with that for a space of time within four months.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	And then since the wound had been amplified, and it was possible for me to intervene with forceps in it, and to remove it, and not to be obliged to do it with a cutting, then I did not cease to skillfully and ingeniously maneuver on it with methods of engineering, until one day on it with methods of engineering I began to hang it with forceps skillfully made, according to how they will come in the form at the end of the chapter, until I extracted it; and then I restored that wound.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	And some doctors judged that the cartilage of the nose was not restored, and I restored it and the wound was consolidated, and the ailment healed completely, and he did not suffer in it in any way.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And I recount to you the quality of the extraction of some arrows so that you may pause this rule and signification upon what I have not said, for the parts of this art and the definitions of it are not comprehended with narration nor do those comprehend it in the book.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	And the wise artificers compare with few about much; and with what is present about what is absent; and finds novel operation and novel instrument of the descent of the foreign causes of the art when they occur.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And therefore I say that arrows are not forth-driven from the members in which they are placed but according to two manners: either by traction of the place in which they enter; or by the contrary of the other part.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And that one which is driven by the place in which it enters, is the arrow proceeding in fleshy place, and it is thrust and forth-driven.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if you do not obey the cutting at the hour in which it catches, then you must leave it for some days until the flesh that is around it can be relaxed, and the traction of it and its egress are relieved.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	And if it is stuck in the bone and does not obey your efforts, then leave it for a few days and repeat it with traction and movement every day, and it will be dislocated.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if it does not obey your efforts, then after a few days, cover that with a sharp needle in the circuit of the arrow in that bone from all parts, with a subtle thread, so that the place is amplified by the arrow, and then extract it.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if the arrow is stuck in the bone of the head and has already proceeded into one of the ventricles of the brain, and appears in the patient some of those accidents that I have said, then abstain from the extraction of the arrow and leave it inside until its being is equal after a few days; for if the arrow reaches the brain, then death is not prolonged for him.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	And if the arrow is not stuck but in the body of the bone alone and does not pass into the brain, and the patient remains for a few days, and no accidents happen to him, then you engineer the traction of the arrow and its traction.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	But if it is stuck and does not obey your extraction, then you administer threads in the circuit of the arrow as we have recounted, and then care for the place until it is healed.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	But if the arrow is already hidden in the place of the body, and is hidden from feeling, then you inquire about it with a probe, and if you feel it, then pull it with some instruments which are convenient for its traction.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	And if you cannot over it because of the constriction of the plague and the length of the preon, and here there is no bone nor nerve nor vein, then you cut on the plague until it is amplified and it is possible to extract the arrow.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if it is to the ears that it is held, then you cut the flesh in which it is stuck from all parts with all the skill that you can do; and engineer on that, if you cannot over the evasion of the flesh in the fracture of the ears and torsion of those until it obeys.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	And when you administer the extraction of the arrow in any place where it is, then you use with a twist of your hand with forceps at all parts until it makes that obey; and subtilly with subtle skill that the arrow is not broken and that it is made to you difficult traction of it and of that extraction.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	And if you cannot over it in your hour, then you leave it for a few days until the parts that are in the circuit of it can be softened, and then repeat it when it is relieved.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	But if to you a contrary flow of blood is made, then you administer what we have said of cure in its chapter.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	And guard your virtue of incision of vein or of nerve, or of cord, and administer skill in every manner to you possible of the evasion of the arrow; and do that with facility and tranquility and tardiness and firmness as I and to you recounted.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	And therefore that you may make contrary the arrow so that the patient be according to the figure according to which you must the placement of the arrow in him, for it is more helpful.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	But if that is not to you possible, then you administer what is to you possible by the figures.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	But the arrows that are dislocated by the contrary of the other part, or that have already from it proceeded any part to the parts outside, or make difficulty the extraction of the arrow by feeling of the part above the codename proper and sometimes that eminent; therefore you cut on that; and be the section according to the quantity in which they grasp the forceps; and then pull that, for it is made lighter to effort.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	But if it is retained in the bone, then you twist the lame contrary until the arrow presses in the bone, and amplify to itself, and then extract it.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	And if not, leave that for a few days, and then repeat it until it comes out.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	And if the shaft of the arrow is in that, then you impel it with it.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	But if the shaft is broken and you want to administer impulse, then you introduce and that, if it is blunt, a curved instrument so that between the concavity of it in the tail of the arrow and then impel it with it.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	But if the arrow is concave, then you impel it with a strong instrument entering into it, for the arrow is relieved by that.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the arrow is envenomated, then cover that with all the flesh in which is the vein, if it is to you possible that, and then care for that with what is convenient.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the arrow catches in the foot, or in the belly, or in the bladder, or in the rib, and is near so that you touch that with the probe, and it is to you possible to cut on that, then cut on that and guard yourself from incision of vein or of nerve, and extract it, and then close the wound if it is indignant, and cure that until it is healed.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	Form of forceps with which arrows are pulled:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	Let the extremities of them be like the beak of a bird that are made like a saw when they grasp on the arrow so that they do not let it go.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And of those are made many kinds, great, few, and small, according to the quantity of the greatness of the arrow and its paucity, and of the width of the wound, and of the constriction of it.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	Method of impelling the concave of this extremity as if with the pain of a bird so that the entry of the arrow into it is eased, and the impulse of that dull:
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Method of impelling the dull extremity:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	as if with a ray so that the entry of it into the concave arrow is eased and it is impelled with that.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	Of phlebotomy of the veins.
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so .xxx., de las quals so en le cap .xvi., so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The veins of phlebotomy of which it is customary to phlebotomize .xxx., of which there are in the head .xvi., There are two pulsatile veins which are near the ears, called alhasisain; two herbs that are in the two temples appear; and two veins that are in two lacrimals of two heels that are called aspicientz; and the prepared vein in the middle location of the forehead, and the vein that is in the extremity of the nose; and two guidegi that are in the neck; and two veins that are in the upper lip; and two veins that are in the lower lip; and — these are the veins that are called algelic —; and there are two veins that are below the tongue.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so .v.; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	But the veins that are phlebotomized in the arms are .v.; because of those, one is cephalic, and it is the wild latz; and the people call "the vein of the head," and dull, and it is a median vein, and it is composed of a branch of the basilica, and another branch of the cephalic; and that one the people call "vein of the whole body," and basilica is the vein which is placed in the domestic latz, and it is called "citillar," and the vulgar people call that "vein of the belly"; and funis of the arm, and it is placed above the focil, and that is the one in which it is phlebotomized, and it is the one that appears on the poutz by manifest appearance; and salvatella, and it is the vein that is between the said auricular and the smallest said, and there are two ramps in it.
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	And in the foot and the leg there are three veins; one of those is that which is below the curvature of the denolh of the wild latz; and the second is sophena, and the location of it is below the leg of the domestic latz; and the sciatic vein, and the location of it is below the leg of the wild latz; and in the leg there are other veins similar to those.
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The benefit of the veins that are near the ears is for ancient catarrhs and emigranea and sahafati and ancient bad headaches.

And the quality of bleeding those is according to what I recommend to you: that it be rasped the head of the patient, and that it be rubbed the head of the patient in the occiput in the location of both veins with a broad cloth with good friction; then tighten the patient's neck with a bandage until the two appear and the locations of them near the ears in two depressed locations of the head; and you feel the pulse of those with your finger, here it feels with a tenta.
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	Then you take the pointed lance, and it is that which is incident, and then you introduce that below the vein in the codena until the phlebotomy comes to the bone.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	And then you elevate your hand with the vein and the codena to the upper parts and you cut the vein with an incident incision.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	And let the length of the incision be the quantity of two fingers adjusted or around that; and make it out of the blood as much as you want.
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	And then tighten with poultices and leave it until it is healed.
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	And already it has preceded at the beginning of the book the incision of those and their cauterization.
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	But of the two arterial veins that are in the temples the benefit of phlebotomy is for ancient emigranea and evil and assiduous ophthalmia and body of acute superfluities effused to the heels.

And then you elevate the codena above the vein to the upper parts with your finger indicated, and introduce the phlebotomy incident below, and elevate the vein upwards; and cut it as you have done in the other two veins; and make the blood run according to the quantity of your need.
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	And then untie the constriction of the patient, and place your finger on the vein for an hour, and then place over that coat and poultices and tighten that above with a strong constriction, and leave it until it is healed.
E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	And already has preceded the remembrance of them, and of those the incision, and the traction at the beginning of the book.
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas. E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the quality of the phlebotomy of it is according to what I recommend to you; it is that the patient tightens their neck with a bandage until the vein appears; and then you take the instrument which is called fossori of which this is the shape of it:

E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	And sometimes it is opened with a fleubotomist lat, however, no cove that the fleubotomist is of acute extremity as the others, rather it is of blunt extremity, and fleubotomize that according to the transverse, because the bone is proper and strong it would break in it the fleubotomist when it is subtle.
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.	But the benefit of the two veins that are at the lacrimals of two heels by scabies of the heels by rogor and sebol in the heels, and to the ailments of the face.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu.	And the quality of the fleubotomia is that the patient strengthens the neck with a bandage, and then fleubotomize those, and you be standing over the head of it.
E sia fayta la fleubotomia segon le transvers a longitut un pauc am fleubotomi pauc, quar en le loc no es carn; e si le fleubotomi es subtil, fort leu la extremitat de lu es trencada.	And be made the fleubotomia according to the transverse along the longitude a little with fleubotomist a little, because in the place there is no flesh; and if the fleubotomist is subtle, very much the extremity of it is broken.
E aprop fay correr del sanc atant quant es a tu necessari, e pausa sobre aquelas coto, e strenh aquelas per una nueyt, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And then make run of the blood as much as is to you necessary, and pause over those cuto, and strengthen those for a night, and then untie those.
Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.	But the fleubotomia of the vein of the nose is conferent to acute fever and to soda vehement, and to the ailments of the face and emigranea and rogor that accideys in the face, and more when it is ancient.

And the quality of the fleubotomia of it is that the patient strengthens his neck and then take his nose with your left hand, and take the fleubotomist subtle long and place that in the middle place of the head of the nose according to rectitude, because the vein does not appear to the sentiment here, and because the blood begins to flow soon.
Cove que tu ultimes la tua ma am le fleubotomi petit a petit e fassas correr del sanc segon la tua necessitat; e aprop lia aquela per una nuoyt, quar aquela es restaurada leugierament.
