E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	And the quality of the fleubotomia of those is that the patient strengthens himself with each one in his neck with liament; and stay the artifices over the head of the patient, and the patient be sitting on a sella.
E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	And then fleubotomize the vein along with fleubotomist ample little by little; and then extract of blood according to temperate quantity or according to what you times of necessity that is ad to it; and then make semblant of the other vein.
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	And then untie the liament and strengthen the two veins with strictura migiera so that the patient is not prefabricated, and leave it until the morning when the plague is healed.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	And the benefit of the fleubotomia of the algerich veins, conferreys to small apostemas and pustulas of the mouth and corruption of the gums and bad ulcerations and fissures, and to bad ulcerations that are in the nose and in the circuit of it.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident.	And the quality of the fleubotomia of those is that you make cezer the patient before you, and strengthen the neck of it with a bandage, and then revolve the labias of it and regard to two veins of which the one is of the right of the labia and the second of the left; and the demonstration of each one is by the blackness of each one of both, and this may is because in the circuit of those so veins little black; and therefore inscideys each one by inscizio inscident.
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	But if dubitacio is of you, and you do not know which one of those is, then you enter to inscizio of the major of those, and of the pus manifesta of those.
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	And make the semblant of the two veins that are in the labias desus.
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	But costuma corr may to inscidir the two veins that are in the labia dejos.
Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.	But of two veins that are dejos the tongue the juvament is to the fleubotomia of the cephalica to prefocacios that are in the guolayro, to the ailment of the uvula, and to ailments of the mouth.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es que segue le malaute entre las tuas mas denant le solel, e eleva la lengua de lu, e reguarda dejos la lengua, de la un latz de lu vena e del autre latz vena, e la color de quascuna es declinant a negror.	And the quality of fleubotomar those is that you follow the malaute between your hands before the solel, and elevate the tongue of it, and regard ofjos the tongue, of the un latz of it vein and of the other latz vein, and the color of each one is declining to blackness.
E adonc fleubotoma quascuna; e guarda te que no ultimes la tua ma en fleubotoman aquelas, quar dejos aquelas so arterias.	And therefore fleubotomize each one; and guard you that you do not ultimes your hand in fleubotoman those, because ofjos those so arterias.
E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And your veins that are fleubotomadas in the coyde are in those that corr costuma in all the men, and the fleubotomia of them is fayta according to two manieyras, or pongen am the fleubotomist mirtilat or olivar to subtilitat declining; or secsar am fleubotomist cutellar, and apelha si alnessil, and this is the form of it:
E aquest alnessil es que conveneys a seccio e de aquels so specias latz e subtils segon la amplitut de las venas e segon la strictura de aquelas.	And this alnessil is that conveneys to seccio and of those so specias latz and subtils according to the amplitut of the veins and according to the strictura of those.
Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	Way of Flebotomy of the Myrtle:
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	Let the patient's arm be as if it were, and it is necessary to open the concave veins full that appear thick, and to those that contain thick, turbid blood.
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	And this is the way of flebotomy olive:
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	And this flebotomy is of less latitude and of more subtle extremity, and it is necessary to flebotomize subtle veins that contain subtle, citric blood.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	But the benefit of flebotomy of the basilica vein, which is one of three veins: that which extrates the blood of the illnesses that are left the throat and the neck, and from that which affects the feet and the belly.
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	And it is necessary for the flebotomist, when flebotomizing that, to guard well and be over-fearful in that, because after it there is an artery, and if he errs and adjusts in the puncture of the flebotomy, he will cut that artery and there will flow fluxes of blood, so that he who flebotomizes that with flebotomy pungent, should raise it as if it were an incisor.
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the basilica does not appear by manifest appearance, then it is necessary that you leave that one and that you change to the other, or that you seek some branch of it; or that you flebotomize in the place of it, at the end of the arm, because that one is manifest; and cut that one with flebotomy incisor as we have said.
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	But if you want the flebotomy of the meister vein, then it is necessary that before the stricture of the arm you touch the place between that you know the place of the wrists, and then press on it with a finger; and then lift the arm and cut the vein with concave section with flebotomy incisor as we have said; and guard yourself that the percussion for some space of the place of the artery.
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	And when you see, as if you were strengthening the ligament, inflammation in the place that you have pressed with a finger, then that inflammation is inflammation of the artery, and therefore avoid that.
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	And if you see the blood flow in the flebotomy as if it were of a child, and the blood is subtle, then you know that it is of the blood of the artery; and then you stop and place your finger over that for a long space; and then oppose your finger, and if the blood is cut, because it has been cut several times, then you strengthen the arm and leave that.
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	And guard the patient from the moccio of him, and be over-fearful of him and do not harm him for some days until he is healed.
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	But if the blood is not cut, and you see that you must not present medicine to that, then you cut the artery, if it appears to you; because the extremity of it is contracted, and the blood is cut; or that you take a strip of fig, and fen that, and take the one majority and strengthen that over the place of the vein at the stricture descending to the ligament and to the pulses within the other day.
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	And then if the blood is cut, it is good; and if not, then cure that with the water of which it is preceded to the memory of the place of the polveras cutting fluxes of blood.
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	And the abscizio of the blood of it is difficult in many dispositions because of the small place of the plague and the possibility of the ligament of the arm.
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	But of the fusca vein the flebotomy is a benefit that extrates the blood of the superior part of the head and the part below the body; because for that it is composed of branches of the basilica and of branches of cephalica, as we have said.
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	And it is necessary for the flebotomist that one be over-fearful in the flebotomy of it, because after that there is a nerve; and therefore if it adjusts in the puncture of the flebotomy and touches the nerve, it will cause stupor to him, and it is difficult the healing of it, and fort he is not healed of all, And this nerve many times appears to the feeling; and if it is hidden to some men and it is subtle and is not shown, then it is necessary that you pause the flebotomy with the one with which you flebotomize with section of incisor, and avoid the nerve with your strength.
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	And if the vein is between two nerves, then you cut the vein in the length.
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The benefit of flebotomy of the cephalica vein is that it attracts the blood of the head and comforts the illnesses of the heels.
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	And it is necessary in this properly, if you want that the flebotomy be done with flebotomy olive or with flebotomy myrtle; because it is the most safe of all the veins, because it is not below it artery nor nerve.
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	But however, it is necessary for you that you flebotomy that you guard that with the flebotomy you do not prick the head of the lacert so only, and seek the place most light, and do not note to it, if it is not touched with the first percussion that it is over that with flebotomy several times.
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	But however, fort he is apostemat in some men, when it is not flebotomized in the first percussion, but do not note in re that apostema.
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	But the quality of the flebotomy of it and the accidents of it are much, in which you have to consider in their rectification.
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	The first of it is that you should know that flebotomy is not administered unless in the preservation of health and for the hope of it and the precaution of the coming of illnesses, and that it should be flebotomy in one of the veins that are in the body, that is: cephalica, fusca and basilica; and that it should be flebotomy at the beginning of spring, after fasting in spring and autumn, and in winter near the meal, when there appear signs of repletion.
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	And a phlebotomy should be made on the third day or at the first hour after three hours have passed of the day.
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	May the phlebotomy administered be done when it brings convenience and necessity, either at night or during the day, at any hour and at any time.
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	And let it be known that a child should not be phlebotomized before they have reached fourteen years, and a woman who is pregnant should not be phlebotomized until the fourth month and up to the seventh, and the elderly should not be phlebotomized if they have already passed sixty years.
E cum alcu vol esser fleubotomat per qualque manieyra sia, cove que mondifique les sieus budels denant la fleubotomia am clisteri leon, si en aquels ha mota fenda retenguda, per so que las venas no atiro las superfluitatz en la fleubotomia dels budels, que son puridas, e que no noguan als membres principals.	And as anyone who wishes to be phlebotomized in any way, let them cleanse their bowels beforehand with a lion's enema, if there is a large amount of fecal matter retained, so that the veins do not draw the superfluities into the phlebotomy of the bowels, which are purified, and that they do not harm the main limbs.
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.	And let not those patients who are nauseous, excessively hungry, or suffering from illness or drunkenness be phlebotomized until they have recovered from it, nor those suffering from dropsy. And more so, let phlebotomy be feared in cases of colic, vomiting, abdominal pain, and multiplication of coitus, labor, and exercise of fasting or vigils, and from any cause that dissolves the virtue, whether corporeal or animal.
E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.	And before this, consider in the subtle modification of humors, if the blood is thick, with foods and drinks, and with medicines if it is possible to do so.
E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	And before this, consider in the subtle modification of humors, if the blood is thick, with foods and drinks, and with medicines if it is possible to do so.
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	And perform the phlebotomy on the foot at the hour of terce, as we have said.
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.	And see that the foot of that person be guarded on that day from all evils, both animal and corporal, such as anguish, anger, fear, and from all corporal accidents, such as labor and superfluous pain, and coitus and similar acts.
E a la sua sezelha fassa esser presentz las causas en le us de la qual corr costuma dels homes am aromaticitat e odorament e am bals e semblantz ad aquels segon la cantitat de possibilitat.	And to his bed, let them make present the causes in the use of which custom of men, with aromatics and scents, and with balsams and similar things according to the quantity of possibility.
E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	And let the phlebotomist follow on a cushion that is softer than the cushion of the one who is to be phlebotomized.
E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.	And then extract his arm, and rub it with his hand the phlebotomist two or three times; and then tighten the ligament with a strap and wrap it two times.
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	And let the stricture be temperate, for if the stricture is not equal, or the stricture is with superfluity, then prohibit the flow of blood; or if it is with softening, then prohibit the body of the blood from rising.
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.	And after the stricture, let him who is to be phlebotomized rub his hands together between them while the veins are inflated, and are declared to the touch.
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	And after the stricture, let him who is to be phlebotomized rub his hands together between them while the veins are inflated, and are declared to the touch.
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	And therefore, for this, let the phlebotomist be halted and be solicited in all these causes.
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	And after the phlebotomy, if the vein is opened in one go, then well is it; and if not, then repeat it another time after that place a little, or upon it with a festoon, if the place is not inflamed.
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	And if the place is inflamed, or the patient is frightened, then leave it for a day or two, and do not tighten the ligament, for if it is strongly pulled, it will draw the abscess, nor enter into a bath.
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	And after this, repeat the phlebotomy if the need arises.
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	And if the opening is small and the blood flows subtly, and you fear that there will not be the quantity of blood that you desire, then repeat the phlebotomy in that tract according to rectitude and adjust in the opening a little, and do this with a festoon before the place is inflamed, for the place is inflamed in many men because of a little opening.
Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	But if you see that it is already inflamed, then do not repeat upon it, for excuse yourself to no cause; and place upon it some portion of the wound of olive oil, for it alleviates the flow of blood.
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	And it is better in this place that olive oil and that other oils.
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	And similarly administer the wound of olive oil in every phlebotomy with which you phlebotomize the veins, with the prohibition of the flow of blood, and do this with tyriaca alfadoc and sagzenea when it is placed upon the place, for the blood is refined and is revolved when it is thick.
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.	And if a large abscess is generated at the site of the phlebotomy, which happens several times, and especially to those who have not been bled but only this time, or at the opening of the small vein, then you cover it, and place on the area a sponge soaked in water and salt, a little scalded, and strengthen it for an hour, for it is dissolved.
E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	And cover that which is done to the bleeding of that vein with the completion of it or of another vein.
E si roman en le loc per alcus dias alcuna negror o viriditat, no notz aquo; e si voles, pausa sobre aquel alcuna causa de aloen e de mirra dissolvut, o alcuna causa de suc de mentastre o de calament o semblant de lu.	And if, in the area, for some days, there remains some blackness or greenness, do not notice it; and if you want, place on that some cause of aloes and myrrh dissolved, or some cause of mint juice or calament or something similar to it.
E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.	And several times abscesses and swellings happen after phlebotomy of the basilica.
E donc pausa la tua ma sobre aquela, e si lahoras tu atrobas mollicia deves la tua compressio sobre aquela, lahoras aquela eminencia es malvada e mala; e adonc guarda te que pauses sobre aquela alcuna causa de aquo que havem dit, quar fort leu fluira de la arteria sanc.	And therefore place your hand over it, and if then you feel softness under your compression, then that eminence is bad and evil; and therefore guard yourself that you place on it any cause of what they have said, for it might flow strongly from the artery.
E fay emplaustre am aquo en que es stipticitat, per que le loc sia endurat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And make a poultice with water in which it is styptic, so that the place may be endured, and then cure it with the other cure until it is healed.
E cove que extraguas del sanc a tot hom segon la quantitat de la sua vertut e segon la color vencent sobrc le sanc segon que appar.	And cover that you extract blood from every man according to the quantity of his virtue and according to the color of the blood as it appears.
Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu.	Because if the blood is black, then you let it flow until it is red; and similarly if you see it thick, then you let it flow until it is thinned; and similarly if it is acute, until the sharpness of it is gone.
E cove ad aquel que es ple e fort e ha necessitat de extraccio de sanc en una veguada, que sia amplificada la fleubotomia de la vena e le fleubotomi sia lat. E en aquel que es freul, sia fayt le contrari de aquel, e cove que extragua aquel en tropas veguadas, e que le trauc sia streyt.	And in one who is frail, let the opposite of that be done, and cover that you extract it in several times, and that the cut be narrow.
E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.	And the best that is administered in phlebotomy of the vein is that it be the transverse section, not the puncture.
E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut.	And this manner of phlebotomy is safe from the flow of blood and from the incision of nerves, and is more praiseworthy and safer than phlebotomy according to width and length.
E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre.	And to which it is customary for syncope to occur after phlebotomy, and cover that you cure that before the phlebotomy with a little bread soaked in wine of millegrains or simple oxymel scalded; and extract from the one blood in three or four times.
E si es enfregiditat de compleccio, lahoras prengua denant la fleubotomia pa infus en eyssarop de mirra o en eyssarop de mel aromatizat am specias ayssi cum am pebre, canela, gingiebre e semblantz, o en eyssarop aromatizat e mot odorant.	And if it is a cold complexion, then before the phlebotomy, prepare a poultice soaked in a myrrh syrup or in a honey syrup flavored with spices such as pepper, cinnamon, ginger, and similar ones, or in a syrup flavored with aromatic and fragrant odors.
E si accideys sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e es causa de lu issiment de mot sanc, lahoras cove que prengua en beure aygua de carn e eyssarop mot odorant subtil; e use de aromaticitat am algualea, e sia linit le sieu pietz am aquela.	And if syncope occurs after phlebotomy, and the cause of it is the emission of too much blood, then cover that you prepare a poultice in water of meat and a very fragrant syrup; and use of aromaticity with some incense, and let the patient's feet be warmed with it.
E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	And use of the other causes that have been said in the division in the chapter of syncope by evacuation.
E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.	And he who wants to evacuate his arm and dissolve his blood gradually, cover that to him whose phlebotomy is by moderate evacuation, and whose virtue is cold, that he evacuate the blood little by little, so according to the quantity of the virtue in the continuous days.
Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia.	But he who wants to evacuate his arm, and take out his blood a second time, and whose body is strong, then do so about seven or nine hours from the first phlebotomy.
Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.	But he who wants to draw the blood from his body in the opposite direction from the part that it declines, cover that it be evacuated on the second day or the third.
Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	But that body in which there is a lot of blood already scalded and it is acute and causes fever, cover that it be drawn from it blood in one time and a large quantity be thrown out and the opening be amplified until syncope occurs, because you will have preserved all the conditions of phlebotomy; and that you place your hand over the wrist of it according to the body of the blood, so that it does not die in the place of syncope, because many times this happens when the phlebotomist is ignorant and negligent.
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal.	And do not cover that when you want to untie the arm and evacuate the blood a second time, as the orifice of the vein is already closed and it is made difficult to emit the blood, that you press upon it with vehemence and bend it slightly, because that is too bad.

E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	And if the vein is apostate, then leave it and do not touch it until the abscess is settled.
E si necessitat te provoca a evacuar le sanc segondament, e no es excusacio, lahoras tu sagna aquel sobre aquel loc o en l’autre bras en autra vena. E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas.	And the vein called "funis of the arm" is phlebotomized in place of the fusca or of the basilica, when those are not found or are hidden, because it is composed of those.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	And the quality of the phlebotomy of him is that the patient inserts his hand in warm water until the vein appears clearly and visibly.
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut. E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	And be the incision wide and be your phlebotomy the one with which you phlebotomize that one on the joint of the hand a little.
E si es prohibit le fluxs del sanc, lahoras tu itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e layssa le sanc correr en la aygua entro que consieguas la tua necessitat. Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	But if you were in the days of summer, then you are excused from the repetition of the hand in the warm water, and the measure is placed the body of the blood in warm water in time of winter.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And the phlebotomy of this vein is safer than all the others, because it has no pulsating vein, nor nerve.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And the phlebotomy of the saphenous vein of the right hand is good for the diseases of the liver.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	And the quality of the phlebotomy of him is that you tighten the limb or your hand, because you have placed it in warm water, until the vein is inflated and clearly demonstrated to the viewer; and then perform phlebotomy transversely; and if you have incised that of all, do not let it bleed.
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	And preserve that you do not end your hand with the phlebotomy, because it leaves the nerves of the fingers denuded of flesh.

And then repeat the hand in the warm water and let the blood run into it, because if you do not repeat it in the warm water, the blood will coagulate in the orifice of the vein, and it is prohibited from flowing.

And as it is extracted the blood according to the quantity of need, then you place on the vein oil and salt, so that it may not be consolidated tightly; and similarly, you should do in every straight vein.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	But the benefit of the phlebotomy of that of the left hand, is that it is good for the diseases of the spleen.

E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	And the benefit of the saphenous vein phlebotomy is for the ailments that are in the part below the body, such as diseases of the womb, and retention of menstruation, and for ailments of the lungs and ulcers of the thighs and arms old, and their likenesses of ailments.

E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	And therefore phlebotomize the widest branch or below the camba, where the talo is, because it is better and safer.
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	And if you phlebotomize that on the surface of the foot, then you guard yourself from the nerves that are below that on the surface of the foot, and place your phlebotomy with the one with which you phlebotomize by the transverse, as if you wanted to incise it.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And be the phlebotomy voil.
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	But if the flow of blood is prohibited; then you repeat the foot of him in the warm water and let the blood run into it until it is evacuated.
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the phlebotomist errs in the first attempt, then repeat with the phlebotomy in a little, because the place is safe; and do not fear of him malice, but that you guard yourself from the nerves as we have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	And similarly do of the saphenous vein of the other foot equally.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And of the sciatic vein, the place as we have said is below the cavity of the left part.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the benefit of the phlebotomy of it is for pain of the hip when it is for blood caused.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	And the quality of the phlebotomy of it is that the patient enters in a bath, and fastens and tightens the thigh of him from the side of the wide above the talo above four fingers in a long, subtle bandage, so that it appears not otherwise than by that.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And therefore when it appears, then you phlebotomize it according to each engine that is to you possible and according to the transverse, and it is better; or incise it by incision or secces it by section, because the place of it is safe.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And it is in many men well-known; and if you feel that, and it does not appear to the sense of all, then phlebotomize some branch of it, and it is the one that appears in the back of the foot opposite the auricular and the annular.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And guard yourself from the nerves, and make run of the blood the quantity that you want.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	And then untie the bandage and place on the place of the phlebotomy a poultice and tighten the place, because lightly it is healed.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of cupping and the qualities of using those.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Cupping is of horns, or of glass, or of iron.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And ventilation is done in two ways: one of them is with incision and extraction of blood, and the other is ventilation without incision.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this ventilation that is without incision is done in two ways, whether it is with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And the ventilations that are administered with incision and extraction of blood are fourteen places in the body, of which one in which ventilations are placed is the occiput, and it is the back part of the head; and the middle place of the two parts of the neck together; and ventilations of the chin below the mandible past the mouth; and ventilations of the two shoulder blades; and ventilations of the hypochondria, and it is above the end of the rib; and ventilations of the two armpits; and ventilations of the two groins.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And ventilation does not extract blood but from the small veins scattered in the flesh, and therefore it does not capture the virtue through those, as it is captured by phlebotomy; nor is it advisable that ventilation be done with fire or without fire in any illness caused by repletion until the whole body is evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	But if necessity provokes ventilation for illness or for continuity, let us administer it at every hour at the beginning of the month and at the end of it, and in the middle of it and in any time that is.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The cause of this is that of men in whom blood is multiplied inside that it is indigenous to extraction of it by ventilation and it is found in their head heaviness and soddenness; and of those it is found that it finds repletion and redness in their face and in their head, and in their neck; and of those it is found that it finds pruritus in their face and in their forehead and darkness and heaviness in their eyes; and of those who vomit the place of their ventilation; and of those it is found that their laughter is multiplied; and of those it is found that it finds taste of blood in their mouth, or that the tongue is apoplectic and spits blood; and of those it is found that their sleep is multiplied, and of those who vomit blood in sleep redness and ancients and plagues and other causes to their semblance.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And therefore when times in any of those causes, and properly if it is in the third or middle of the month, then command ventilation to be done more than it is passed from the day two or three hours.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And the benefit of ventilation of the neck is that when that confers gravity to the head and to that which is poured into the eyes; but it is advisable that that be near evacuation of the whole body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this ventilation is in the place of phlebotomy of the cephalic.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	And it is not good to use it for those who are of cold complexion, or in whom there is catarrh, because it gives great harm to those.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And for that reason it is not advisable to use it for the elderly, and in whose heads there are cold ailments.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	But to those who are continuing over it is done oblivion; and for that reason it is advisable that you command the ventor to pause his hand a little with the ventouse at the parts below, fearing the generation of oblivion.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	But ventilation of the armpit is in the place of phlebotomy of the vena fusca and the basilica: and for that reason it confers on asthma, and on the constriction of the ale and on the scissura of the sturment of ale, and on cough, and on repletion.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And it is advisable that the armpit ventilation be pulled a little, because if it is placed below, it generates weakness in the body and in the stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And the ventilation of the groin confers on the pains accident in the head and on ophthalmia, and migraine, and pre-focacio, and pains in the roots of the teeth; and it is in the place of phlebotomy of the basilica.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And it is advisable that you command the ventor that he not press his hand with incision so that it does not pierce the artery and accides flux of blood.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	And ventilation below the chin confers on alcohol in the mouth, and on corruption of the gums, and semblance to those of the illnesses that are in the mouth, and stand in the place of phlebotomy of aliheric that is in the two lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	But the ventilation that is done on the two shoulder blades confers on caphatan, which is made by repletion of heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And the ventilation of the two parts of the armpits confers benefit of phlebotomy of three veins, so it is of the basilica, fusca, and cephalica, because that attracts the blood of all those veins more numerous that are in the flesh, and those small veins of the other veins more gross until the attraction reaches the three veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And command the ventor that too much he not proceed in incision, because the place is denuded of flesh, and below it are nerves and arteries.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And it is a ventilation with which it is ventilated over the buttocks and confers on the hemorrhoids of the anus and on the ulcers below.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And it is advisable that you command the ventor that it be a large ventouse, and that it be of iron, because the place indigenous of strong section; and strong lew are called subtle ventilations and it is scarified with incision.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	But ventilations of the legs are less by minutio manifestation, because they draw the blood of the whole body, and confer on old pains of the lungs and of the uterus, and of the bladder; and they provoke the menses, and confer on bothor and ademil; and they stand in the place of phlebotomy of two sophenas, and alahorcoben, and of two groins.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	But it weakens the whole body and causes syncope in many men.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And from the winds, the heat is proper to the heat of two legs.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	And the quality of the position of the winds is that you pause the wind at the beginning, and suck it in with temperate suction, and do not prolong the position of the winds, but pause them lightly, and move them gently, and that the humors come to the place by equal advancement.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not cease to iterate this and continue until you see the place already reddened and inflated, and that the redness of the blood appears.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	And then you scarify and iterate the suction little by little, and then consider in the disposition of the bodies.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	Because that man who has tender flesh of rare pores, because you scarify him once and no more, so that the place is not ulcerated.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And command the wind-operator to amplify the scarification and proceed a little, and temper the suction with ease.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if in the blood there is thickness, then you must scarify twice, because in the first scarification the way of subtilization to the blood and its liquidity is opened.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	But in the second, the scrutiny acquired from the extraction of the thick blood.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is very foul, then the third scarification is made so that the last (is achieved).
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	And finally, when we want to extract the blood little by little or a little, it suffices us one scarification.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we want the extraction of much blood, we scarify with many scarifications; and if we knew that the blood is thick, then we must scarify with a deep scarification.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the term of scarification in which the depth of the incision is only so much.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if that one whose incision is thick, hard, dark, and whose pores are narrow, then the places of the winds should be anointed more gently, more open, more resolved; if it is in summer, as is oil of aloes or oil of violets, or oil of double amaranth, or oil of quince; and if it is in winter, then oil of narcissus, or oil of lily, or oil of chamomile, or of saffron, and to those similar.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if the superfluity is thick, hot, then the oil should be of amaranth, or oil of balsamita, or oil of aloes, or oil of fennel, and to those similar.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	But if the wind-operator has wide pores of tender flesh, then he should be prohibited from oil, and he should have the places of the winds near his own application be washed with waters or with cold water of solastrum, or with quince water, or with water of borlaguas, and similar to those.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And he whose blood is of much humidity, washes his winds with sour wine, or with myrtle water and sumac, and similar to those.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And he whose superfluities are thick, washes his winds with old wine, or with water of sarsaparilla, which is marjoram, or of decoction of fennel, or of chamomile, and to those similar.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And the wind-operator should be guarded before bathing; he should be administered near the bath for an hour or two, and he should sleep near the wind-application.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What should be done to regulate the wind-operator before phlebotomy?
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	At the beginning, you should consider: if the wind-operator or the one who is to be phlebotomized is choleric and windy, and his blood is sharp and inflamed, then he should be given cooling causes, such as vinegar-soaked millet, endive with sour wine and lettuce, and secanabin, and syrup, and to those similar.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And pause their meals as much as possible, and birds' meat, and foods seasoned with vinegar, and to those similar.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And for him whose constitution is cold, he should be given to drink syrup of almiva, or syrup of alsecanabin of seeds, and sumac, and wine very fragrant between old and new; and that he should be commanded to use little drinking and eating, and pause his meals as much as possible, and eat little birds, and rabbits, and sparrows, and small birds, and doves.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And that on the day of wind-application and phlebotomy, the drink should be greater than the food.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And that some men should be given to drink in some hours,  tyriaca alpharac, or medicines of musk, that is, muscat, or alcelita before the wind-application or phlebotomy, or near it, so that the main members be comforted and the blood be subtiliated; and that they should not take that scalfatz.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	But the winds that are scarifications should be winds that are paused on the liver, and on the spleen, and podagra, and on the navel, in the places of the groin, and the side of the hip, because these members do not suffer scarification upon themselves.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not desired for those, but rather attraction of blood from the limb, as if you pause a wind on the nipple in the illness of blood flow from the blood of the nose; and use it so that it may be dissolved cold windiness of the limb, as if you pause on the belly and navel; because that thins the limb and scalfs it and removes the pain because it resolves the windiness.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And it is placed on the sores when they happen in their opening or boil, because by virtue of strong attraction the man opening and eradicates the boil from its place.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And similarly it is done when it is placed on the liver and spleen, when there is windiness in those enclosed places.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	And these windinesses are administered voids with suction alone; and some times are administered with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And some times are administered full of water  tebeza in the illnesses of the spleen.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And this is why the windpipe is filled and made larger, so it is water poured alone or water in which herbs are boiled for that purpose.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of windpipe administered with fire: its width of the orifice of two fingers, according to how we have formed it; and the quantity of the preon is the majority of a palm; and it is in the place of it, in the place that is in the circuit, the majority of it, the tract be small according to the quantity that enters it a needle.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	It is made of  eram rog or citron, of large margins, lion,  enguals and terses so that it does not lead the member of its position over it.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And in the middle of it a transverse bar of eram or of iron, on which a candle is placed with the fire.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And already this windpipe is larger than the one we have recounted; and the few smaller than that according to the illnesses and the state of him who uses it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the windpipes of the infants and exhausted are others than the windpipes of the young and of large bodies.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the quality of pausing this windpipe with fire on the member is that it extends the fire with wood decently in front of a small candle of wax, and places it on the middle of the transverse bar in the middle place of the windpipe, so that the fire is ignited around the part behind so that it does not burn the body of the patient.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And then it is placed on the member of the patient, and the finger is on the tract that we have said,  into that when we have the windpipes and do not indicate that we show the finger and that it escapes the vapor on that tract, then the windpipe is immediately dissolved.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And then keep the fire according to its manner, and repeat that if it is indicated of that.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	But in a windpipe that is administered in the illness of pleurisy, with water, in which there is no transverse bar nor tract, and it is not administered unless it is filled with water, and it is placed on the member alone.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is the form of it: And this windpipe as much as it is larger, so much is better, because it can receive a large quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter .xcvii.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Bloodletting is not administered in all members but in those members in which it is not possible to place windpipes, because of the smallness of those, such as the mouth and gums and similar to them; or in members naked of flesh, such as the finger and the nose and their similar.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those that have been found leeches that are in the waters of  poredura mundas.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And then they are laid the day and the night in water of  poredura mundas into that they are famolentas, and that no remains any cause in the belly of those; and then it is evacuated the body at the beginning with fleubotomia and with windpipes; and then it is rubbed the member of the patient into that it reddens; and then they are placed on it.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And as they are filled and case.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible suction of the place with windpipe, it is more better in help.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then wash the place with vi agre and then with much water; and be rubbed and pressed.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the course of the blood is prolonged and the result of the leeches, then you put a cloth of it in cold water, and place it on top until the perspiration is abated.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the blood is multiplied, then pulverize on it vitriol trissat, or guallas and similar to them of the causes stipticas, into that the blood is abscissed; or are placed on the place the halves of favas excocicadas, and are laid into that the favas adhere to the place, and the blood is abscissed.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And now, if necessary, repetition of leeches, when it is possible to change those.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the leeches are prohibited from suspension, then be rubbed the place with recent blood or leave a needle in the places into that blood escapes; and then they are placed, because those when they feel some blood immediately adhere.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to fall off, pulverize on them a little of aloen trissat, or salt, or ash, and they fall off immediately.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the prolec of the third part: of restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is many times necessary in the art of medicine; and the restoration of fracture and dislocation accident in the bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh, son, know that these fools of doctors and the vulgar boast of this chapter and those who never at any time regarded the books of the Ancients nor read from them a letter.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason, it is made that this manner of the learned in our land is deprived; and you have not forgotten this at any time well of all; and I have not adopted this that I have presented, but for the length of reading the books of the Ancients and study on the understanding of those, while I extracted the science from those.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And then I devote myself to experiment and study throughout the length of my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described in this chapter all that my science contains and on which my best experiment has been passed; because I have shortened this for you others and delivered it from the occupation of elongation; and I have shortened it at the end of shortening; and I have shown it at the end of declaration; and I have formed in it many forms of the instruments that are administered in it, as it has been done by addition of declaration, as I have done in the two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	First Chapter.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summaries and collections from the broken bones, from those whose introduction is necessary before we begin the remembrance of broken and diverse members of each one.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, I say that in the prologue of this chapter the summaries of the sermon; and the chapters to the understanding of which at the beginning is forced the artificers and to stay on the truth of those; so is you and those who are prompt to know or learn this noble art others than you.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And therefore I say that when you come across a fracture or dislocation or sprain or wound, then you must at the beginning apply yourself to phlebotomy or to drain that, or one of the two, if no cause prohibits, as is the weakness of virtue, or the one to whom you come across is a child, or old in decrepitude, or the time of vehement heat, or of vehement cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And then be content in his food of cold herbs and of birds' meats and of crabs; and forbid thick meats and to fill him with foods and of all food that fills the veins with blood, until you are sure of a cauterized abscess, and if you do not fear effusion of matter to the limb.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to his first regimen to which he is accustomed.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And therefore, as the broken bone begins to be restored, then the patient must be fed with nutritious foods of nourishment thick and heavy in which is viscosity, as are foods made of boiled wheat with water, and rice, and heads, and fish, and bellies of cows, and eggs, and fresh birds, and thick meat and similar to those, and with this regimen is made coagulation of fracture more lightly and better.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And know that the broken bones when they are in the young and in the decrepit, it is not possible that they be continued and consolidated according to their nature by the drying of their limbs.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are consolidated and continued according to their nature all times by the drying of those limbs, and they are continued and consolidated those that are of their in the end of the youth, as the bones of the little children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	May, however, nature adjusts and amnesties over the broken bone from every part any cause seeming to glut in which is thickness that adheres and strengthens that within as they are at once conglutinated and tied together, until they come to the end of fortitude and firmness, as fire at the beginning, until no cause prohibits that of its works.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this cause it is necessary that you pause the foods of the patient, foods in which there is heaviness and viscosity and thickness, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Many diversity of fracture according to the diversity of the limb.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the species of fracture are diverse according to the diversity of the limbs, for the fracture of the bone of the leg is diverse from the fracture of the bone of the head; and the fracture of the bone of the foot is diverse from the fracture of the bone of the hand; and similarly all the other limbs are diverse among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And you come with remembrance of all species of fracture, explained in their distinct chapter from the other.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	Many diversity of fracture in itself.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And they are diversified the species of fracture of the bone in their own; for there is made arched fracture another that happens in them stars; and some times is made fracture according to the length of the bone: and in the fractures of the satagia and stars and additions proceeding and not proceeding, as is done in the pen when it is prepared to write, and is fracture with plaque and disruption in the head, and is fracture small fissure.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And to every species is born or torment proper in the restoration of them according to what will come remembrance of them distinct in their places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Many sign of fracture of the bone.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And for this is known fracture of the bone: it is the tortuosity of it, and of that eminence and appearance of it to the touch, and of it when you compress that with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore when there is not in the place apparent tortuosity nor is it felt when you touch the bone with agitation and the patient does not feel great pain, then there is no fracture here.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.
